.MJXp-cal {font-family: MathJax_Caligraphic,'Times New Roman',Times,STIXGeneral,serif}
.MJXp-mono {font-family: MathJax_Typewriter,'Times New Roman',Times,STIXGeneral,serif}
.MJXp-largeop {font-size: 150%}
.MJXp-largeop.MJXp-int {vertical-align: -.2em}
.MJXp-math {display: inline-block; line-height: 1.2; text-indent: 0; font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,STIXGeneral,serif; white-space: nowrap; border-collapse: collapse}
.MJXp-display {display: block; text-align: center; margin: 1em 0}
.MJXp-math span {display: inline-block}
.MJXp-box {display: block!important; text-align: center}
.MJXp-box:after {content: " "}
.MJXp-rule {display: block!important; margin-top: .1em}
.MJXp-char {display: block!important}
.MJXp-mo {margin: 0 .15em}
.MJXp-mfrac {margin: 0 .125em; vertical-align: .25em}
.MJXp-denom {display: inline-table!important; width: 100%}
.MJXp-denom > * {display: table-row!important}
.MJXp-surd {vertical-align: top}
.MJXp-surd > * {display: block!important}
.MJXp-script-box > *  {display: table!important; height: 50%}
.MJXp-script-box > * > * {display: table-cell!important; vertical-align: top}
.MJXp-script-box > *:last-child > * {vertical-align: bottom}
.MJXp-script-box > * > * > * {display: block!important}
.MJXp-mphantom {visibility: hidden}
.MJXp-munderover {display: inline-table!important}
.MJXp-over {display: inline-block!important; text-align: center}
.MJXp-over > * {display: block!important}
.MJXp-munderover > * {display: table-row!important}
.MJXp-mtable {vertical-align: .25em; margin: 0 .125em}
.MJXp-mtable > * {display: inline-table!important; vertical-align: middle}
.MJXp-mtr {display: table-row!important}
.MJXp-mtd {display: table-cell!important; text-align: center; padding: .5em 0 0 .5em}
.MJXp-mtr > .MJXp-mtd:first-child {padding-left: 0}
.MJXp-mtr:first-child > .MJXp-mtd {padding-top: 0}
.MJXp-mlabeledtr {display: table-row!important}
.MJXp-mlabeledtr > .MJXp-mtd:first-child {padding-left: 0}
.MJXp-mlabeledtr:first-child > .MJXp-mtd {padding-top: 0}
.MJXp-merror {background-color: #FFFF88; color: #CC0000; border: 1px solid #CC0000; padding: 1px 3px; font-style: normal; font-size: 90%}
.MJXp-scale0 {-webkit-transform: scaleX(.0); -moz-transform: scaleX(.0); -ms-transform: scaleX(.0); -o-transform: scaleX(.0); transform: scaleX(.0)}
.MJXp-scale1 {-webkit-transform: scaleX(.1); -moz-transform: scaleX(.1); -ms-transform: scaleX(.1); -o-transform: scaleX(.1); transform: scaleX(.1)}

}} catch(e) {}

											<li class="d2l-datalist-item d2l-datalist-simpleitem" id="threadDataListItem_1447687">
												<div class="d2l-datalist-item-content">
													<div aria-live="assertive" id="threadListItemContents_1447687" class="d2l-placeholder d2l-placeholder-inner d2l-placeholder-live">
														<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4521149" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4521149" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4521149" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1447687">

																<div>

																		<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>

																		<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1447687/View" title="Spreadsheet Entry Prediction">Spreadsheet Entry Prediction</a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_105_276" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_106_105" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Spreadsheet Entry Prediction" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",17)();return false;'>

																			<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Spreadsheet Entry Prediction</span>
																		</a>
																		<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_607_444" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																			<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_106_105" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_106_105_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Carter Cook posted Sep 19, 2016 10:20 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_110_327">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_109_31"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_620_438" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",18)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Spreadsheet Entry Prediction">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_621_744" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",19)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Spreadsheet Entry Prediction">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_111_955">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_623_565" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p>1. Currently
spreadsheet pattern-completion can complete single steps or repeats,
such as 1,2,3,4,5 or 1,1,1,1,1 but cannot predict patterns like
exponential scaling or skips, e.g. 1,2,4,8,16 or 2,4,6,8,10. According
to Hornik<sup>1</sup>, single-layer networks serve as a "universal approximator" for any series without hidden or confounding variables.<sup>2</sup></p>
<p>This project is not "important" per se, but may save time in
aggregate, as it will increase automation and lower the barrier to entry
 for unskilled users.</p>
<p>2. The ANN can be fed an initial dataset of excel documents scraped
from google, and trained further using data collected from live users.</p>
<p>3. In addition to pattern prediction, ANNs can be tailored to the
individual using back-propagation to negate incorrect autocompletion,
i.e. give the network suppressing feedback when the user undoes a bad
autocompletion.<sup>3</sup></p>
<p></p>
<p><sup>1</sup><a rel="noopener" href="http://ac.els-cdn.com/0893608089900208/1-s2.0-0893608089900208-main.pdf?_tid=939741b2-7e16-11e6-b364-00000aacb360&amp;acdnat=1474254791_cd2fd48f7276ebbc44329e71c02eff9b">http://ac.els-cdn.com/0893608089900208/1-s2.0-0893608089900208-main.pdf?_tid=939741b2-7e16-11e6-b364-00000aacb360&amp;acdnat=1474254791_cd2fd48f7276ebbc44329e71c02eff9b</a></p>
<p><sup>2</sup><a rel="noopener" href="https://stats.stackexchange.com/questions/63152/what-does-the-hidden-layer-in-a-neural-network-compute">https://stats.stackexchange.com/questions/63152/what-does-the-hidden-layer-in-a-neural-network-compute</a></p>
<p><sup>3</sup><a rel="noopener" href="http://ieeexplore.ieee.org.proxy.queensu.ca/stamp/stamp.jsp?tp=&amp;arnumber=141695">http://ieeexplore.ieee.org.proxy.queensu.ca/stamp/stamp.jsp?tp=&amp;arnumber=141695</a></p>
<p></p></div>

														<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4520983" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4520983" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4520983" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1447601">

																		<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1447601/View" title="Detecting Fraudulent Transactions using an ANN">Detecting Fraudulent Transactions using an ANN</a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_115_965" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_116_49" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Detecting Fraudulent Transactions using an ANN" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",20)();return false;'>

																		</a>
																		<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_629_121" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																			<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_116_49" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_116_49_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																				</li>

																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Yohanna Gad Elrab posted Sep 19, 2016 9:41 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_120_395">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_119_642"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_636_163" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",21)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Detecting Fraudulent Transactions using an ANN">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_637_118" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",22)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Detecting Fraudulent Transactions using an ANN">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_121_758">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_638_487" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p><strong>Project Idea</strong></p>
<p>The payment card industry has grown rapidly in the last few years,
everything is now available online. With the help of credit cards, you
can virtually purchase anything from your home [1]. This, however, made
it easier for credit cards to get stolen and with the prevalence of ATM
skimmers, it gets really hard for credit card providers to differentiate
 a normal transaction from a fraudulent one [5].</p>
<p>Creating a Neural Network that will learn how to tell a normal
transaction from a fraudulent one will help save time and money for both
 consumers and credit card providers [6].</p>
<p>Another aspect this ANN can improve upon is creating a customized
Neural Networks for each credit card user, therefore adopting to each
customer situation and needs and decreasing situations where a normal
transaction is flagged as fraudulent.</p>
<p><strong>Dataset Used</strong></p>
<p>The data set provided by Prof. Dr. Hans Hofmann from University of
Hamburg and from a Czech bank can be used to train the Neural Network
[3][4]</p>
<p><strong>Implementation Method</strong></p>
<p>Since we already have a large data set, we can use a Supervised
Learning Neural Network implemented using a Genetic Algorithm. The data
set mentioned in the earlier step would be used to train our algorithm.</p>
<p>Additionly, we can customize our algorithm to each person/group. By
simply asking each person to mark their transactions as normal or
fraudulent. For a group, we can use&nbsp;statistical behavior of a
certain group according to their location for example.</p>
<p><strong>References</strong></p>
<p><i>[1] Guide to the Financial Data Set</i>. (2016). Retrieved 20 September 2016, from http://lisp.vse.cz/pkdd99/berka.htm</p>
<p>[2] Hofmann, H. (2016). <i>German Credit fraud data</i>. Retrieved 20 September 2016, from http://weka.8497.n7.nabble.com/file/n23121/credit_fruad.arff</p>
<p>[3] Patidar, R. &amp; Sharma, L. (2016). <i>Credit Card Fraud Detection Using Neural Network</i>. Retrieved 20 September 2016, from http://www.ijsce.org/attachments/File/NCAI2011/IJSCE_NCAI2011_025.pdf</p>
<p>[4] Singh, S. (2016). <i>Fraud Detection using Neural Network</i>. <i>Academia.edu</i>. Retrieved 20 September 2016, from&nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="https://www.academia.edu/2813886/Fraud_Detection_using_Neural_Network">https://www.academia.edu/2813886/Fraud_Detection_using_Neural_Network</a>&nbsp;</p>
<p style="padding-left: 30px;">&nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="http://sorry.vse.cz/%7Eberka/challenge/pkdd1999/data_berka.zip">http://sorry.vse.cz/~berka/challenge/pkdd1999/data_berka.zip</a></p>
<p>[5]&nbsp;<i>Fraud Detection Using Neural Networks and Sentinel Solutions</i>. (2016). <i>Neurodimension.com</i>. Retrieved 20 September 2016, from http://www.neurodimension.com/resources/smartsoft.html</p>
<p>[6] Ghosh, S. &amp; Reilly, D. (2016). <i>Credit Card Fraud Detection with a Neural-Network</i>. Retrieved 20 September 2016, from http://bit.csc.lsu.edu/~jianhua/quang.pdf</p></div>
																			</div>

												<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
											</li>
											<li class="d2l-datalist-item d2l-datalist-simpleitem" id="threadDataListItem_1447139">
												<div class="d2l-datalist-item-content">
													<div aria-live="assertive" id="threadListItemContents_1447139" class="d2l-placeholder d2l-placeholder-inner d2l-placeholder-live">
														<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4519928" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4519928" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4519928" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1447139">
															<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">
																<div>
																	<div class="d2l-hidden">
																		<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-inline">
																		<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1447139/View" title="Image Processing for X-Ray Image Analysis">Image Processing for X-Ray Image Analysis</a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_125_722" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_126_290" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Image Processing for X-Ray Image Analysis" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",23)();return false;'>
																			<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">
																			<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Image Processing for X-Ray Image Analysis</span>
																		</a>
																		<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_640_135" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																			<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_126_290" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_126_290_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																					<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_67_164 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Read</span></a>
																				</li>
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_126_290_MarkAllUnread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																					<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_69_361 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Unread</span></a>
																				</li>
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_126_290_FlagThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																					<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_611_264 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Flag Thread</span></a>
																				</li>
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_126_290_PinThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																					<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_613_61 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Pin Thread</span></a>
																				</li>
																				<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_126_290_SeeHistory" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																				</li>
																				<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_126_290_PrintThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																					<a target="_blank" role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_617_821 d2l-newwindow vui-dropdown-menu-item-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1447139/Print"><span>Print Thread</span></a>
																				</li>
																			</ul>
																		</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Matt Hahn posted Sep 19, 2016 4:42 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_130_766">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_129_120"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_647_823" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",24)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Image Processing for X-Ray Image Analysis">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_648_785" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",25)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Image Processing for X-Ray Image Analysis">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_131_269">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_649_169" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p><u>What to do and why it is important</u></p>
<p>Use an ANN for machine learning to use image processing techniques to
 detect bone fractures and related health issues. For example, input a
chest x-ray image of a person with a fractured rib. The application will
 use machine learning to detect the fracture in the rib, and give
details about the fracture, such as location, bone name, etc.</p>
<p>This is important because it can save doctors lots of time. Similar
to how banks scan cheques to prevent a person from reading and recording
 trivial cheque data, this application will scan an x-ray image and make
 a diagnosis to prevent a doctor from having to spend time identifying
bone fractures.</p>
<p>Saving a doctor time is very important because it will give them time
 to work on more important, less trivial, tasks. This is extremely
important for locations where doctors are in high demand and have a high
 work load, such as third world countries. [1]</p>
<p>Machine learning in medical applications is a growing field. Machine
learning with image processing is being used for applications such as
2-D image analysis for x-rays, and 3-D analysis of mammograms to detect
breast cancer. [2, 3]</p>
<p><u>Data to be used</u></p>
<p>ImageNet is an online database containing large scale annotated data
sets. [4] The data set has been used for deep convolutional neural
network training for computer-aided detection and machine learning by
other research groups. “ImageNet offers a very comprehensive database of
 more than 1.2 million categorized natural images of 1000+ classes.”[5]</p>
<p><u>High level idea about how the ANN will be used</u></p>
<p>An x-ray contains lot of image information. Once an x-ray is
filtered, bones appear in light contrast and non-bones appear in dark
contrast. A disconnect of high contrast to dark contrast in an area that
 should be only high contrast will indicate a fracture in the bone. Each
 human’s skeleton has a different size and shape. Machine learning is
needed to train the application what the x-ray should look like.</p>
<p>Meteorological applications implementing machine learning for radar
data uses the same technique. Input radar images are filtered to reduce
the radar sensor noise. Machine learning has to only remove data that is
 noise, without removing valuable weather radar data. [6] This medial
application will do the same, however rather than filter noise, it will
detect anomalies, or disconnections, in bones.</p>
<p>The ANN will be used to filter the x-ray images and detect if a bone fracture exists.</p>
<p><u>References</u></p>
<p>[1] <a rel="noopener" href="https://www.quora.com/Why-is-machine-learning-not-more-widely-used-for-medical-diagnosis">https://www.quora.com/Why-is-machine-learning-not-more-widely-used-for-medical-diagnosis</a></p>
<p>[2] <a rel="noopener" href="http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/7422082/">http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/7422082/</a></p>
<p>[3] [ <a rel="noopener" href="http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/7482149/">http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/7482149/</a></p>
<p>[4] <a rel="noopener" href="http://image-net.org/synset?wnid=n04609531">http://image-net.org/synset?wnid=n04609531</a></p>
<p>[5] <a rel="noopener" href="http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/7404017/">http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/7404017/</a></p>
<p>[6] <a rel="noopener" href="http://jackadam.github.io/2011/how-dark-sky-works/">http://jackadam.github.io/2011/how-dark-sky-works/</a></p></div>

																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446825/View" title="Generating text with Recurrent Neural Networks">Generating text with Recurrent Neural Networks</a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_135_693" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_136_763" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Generating text with Recurrent Neural Networks" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",26)();return false;'>

																			<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Generating text with Recurrent Neural Networks</span>
																		</a>
																		<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_651_965" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																			<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_136_763" class="d2l-contextmenu">

																				</li>
																			</ul>
																		</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Matthew Sherar posted Sep 19, 2016 12:50 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_140_735">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_139_1"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_658_817" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",27)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Generating text with Recurrent Neural Networks">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_659_753" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",28)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Generating text with Recurrent Neural Networks">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_141_222">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_660_43" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p>&nbsp;</p>
<ol>
<li><strong> </strong><strong>What to do&nbsp;and&nbsp;why it is important. Describe existing work done on the topic and provide a list of references</strong></li>
</ol>
<p>Text generation is a very important and active area of research in
artificial intelligence. The goal of the project would be to build a
neural network that can be trained to produce English, sensible
sentences and text. Many companies use chatbots to provide customer
support over the internet. Systems like Siri use deep neural networks to
 respond to the user when asked questions. There has been quite a lot of
 research done in this topic: &nbsp;a paper done by researchers at UofT
build what they describe as the largest RNN application to date, that
can generate text based on training a network off of different sources.
They discuss the process of mixing models to generate text word by word
or character by character and the advantage and challenges faced in
doing so. &nbsp;In addition to scholarly articles there are several
works by bloggers the demonstrate and explain more simply text
generation with RNN.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<ol start="2">
<li><strong> What data set will be used?</strong></li>
</ol>
<p>The data to be used could be any large dataset of plain text. The
choice of text would influence the type of output that the network would
 produce. For example, a large twitter feed dataset could be used to
generate tweets on a certain topic, or a newspaper or novel dataset. It
would be interesting to train the same network with various datasets and
 see how the output is effected.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<ol start="3">
<li><strong> A very high level idea about the ANN or the optimization
algorithm (simulated annealing/genetic algorithm) to be used based on
your reading</strong></li>
</ol>
<p>A Recurrent neural network is like a feed-forward neural network
except that the network is not stateless, meaning that neurons are fed
information from the current pass, as well as from the previous passes
completed in training. This means the weights are time dependent, and
the output is related to the input that came prior. A RNN is suited to
generating text since the network can learn which characters or words
are likely to come after one another, so that the text generated is
sensible.</p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>References</strong>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Sutskever, Ilya, James Martens, and Geoffrey E. Hinton. "Generating text with recurrent neural networks."&nbsp;<em>Proceedings of the 28th International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML-11)</em>. 2011. <a rel="noopener" href="http://www.cs.toronto.edu/%7Eilya/pubs/2011/LANG-RNN.pdf">http://www.cs.toronto.edu/~ilya/pubs/2011/LANG-RNN.pdf</a></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Mikolov, Tomas, and Geoffrey Zweig. "Context dependent recurrent neural network language model."<span>&nbsp;</span><em>SLT</em>. 2012. <a rel="noopener" href="https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/04e0/fefb859f4b02b017818915a2645427bfbdb2.pdf">https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/04e0/fefb859f4b02b017818915a2645427bfbdb2.pdf</a></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Britz, Denny. "DEEP LEARNING FOR CHATBOTS, PART 1 – INTRODUCTION." <em>WILDML</em>. N.p., 6 Apr. 2016. Web. 18 Sept. 2016. <a rel="noopener" href="http://www.wildml.com/2016/04/deep-learning-for-chatbots-part-1-introduction/">http://www.wildml.com/2016/04/deep-learning-for-chatbots-part-1-introduction/</a></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Karpathy, Andrej. "The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Recurrent Neural Networks." <em>Hacker's Guide to Neural Networks</em>. N.p., 21 May 2015. Web. 18 Sept. 2016. &nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="http://karpathy.github.io/2015/05/21/rnn-effectiveness/">http://karpathy.github.io/2015/05/21/rnn-effectiveness/</a></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p></div>

													<div aria-live="assertive" id="threadListItemContents_1446694" class="d2l-placeholder d2l-placeholder-inner d2l-placeholder-live">
														<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4518987" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4518987" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4518987" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446694">
															<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">
																<div>
																	<div class="d2l-hidden">
																		<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-inline">
																		<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446694/View" title="Accent Recognition Using Neural Network ">Accent Recognition Using Neural Network </a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_145_249" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_146_406" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Accent Recognition Using Neural Network " onclick='D2L.O("__g1",29)();return false;'>
																			<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">
																			<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Accent Recognition Using Neural Network </span>
																		</a>
																		<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_662_181" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																			<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_146_406" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_146_406_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																					<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_67_164 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Read</span></a>

																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_146_406_MarkAllUnread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Patrick Gibson posted Sep 19, 2016 11:06 AM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_150_599">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_149_462"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_669_307" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",30)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Accent Recognition Using Neural Network ">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_670_437" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",31)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Accent Recognition Using Neural Network ">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_151_921">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_671_352" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 1.<strong>Project Idea</strong></p>
<p>The world is a very diverse place, with many different cultures
around the globe. The various people that are apart of these cultures
have many different dialects, which leads to many different accents.
There are currently many existing speech recognition models today;
however, many of them do not focus specifically on determining a certain
 accent. Accent recognition could be very useful for a variety of
applications, such as assisting with learning a new language and
improving current speech recognition models. A neural network could be
designed, similar to current speech models, to determine certain
accents.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 2.<strong>Data to be used</strong></p>
<p>To properly train the neural network, a large volume of speech
samples would need to be used. This university affiliated website, <a rel="noopener" href="http://accent.gmu.edu/">http://accent.gmu.edu/</a>,
 contains various different accents from around the world [1]&nbsp;[2].
The speech models all use the same phrase which allows for easier
processing.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 3.<strong>Algorithm</strong></p>
<p>The majority of speech recognition algorithms today use hidden Markov
 models [3]. An alternative method is a feed-forward network using a
genetic algorithm to determine the differences existing between accents
[1].</p>
<h1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 12pt;"><span style="font-size: 10pt;">References</span>:</span></h1>
<table width="100%">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td width="1%">
<p>[1]</p>
</td>
<td>
<p>M. Seal, M. Murray and Z. Khaleq, Accent Recognition with Neural Network, Stanford University , 2011.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="1%">
<p>[2]</p>
</td>
<td>
<p>G. M. Universtiy, "The Speech Accent Archive," [Online]. Available: http://accent.gmu.edu/.</p>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td width="1%">
<p>[3]</p>
</td>
<td>
<p>G. Hinton, L. Deng, D. Yu, G. E. Dahl, A.-r. Mohamed, N. Jaitly, A.
Senior, V. Vanhoucke, P. Nguyen, T. N. Sainath and B. Kingsbury, "Deep
Neural Networks for Acoustic Modeling in Speech Recognition: The Shared
Views of Four Research Groups," IEEE, 2012.</p>
</td>
</tr>

														<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4518523" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4518523" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4518523" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446510">
															<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">
																<div>
																	<div class="d2l-hidden">

																		<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446510/View" title="Using ANN's in Intrusion Detection Systems">Using ANN's in Intrusion Detection Systems</a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_155_234" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_156_488" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Using ANN's in Intrusion Detection Systems" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",32)();return false;'>

																			<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Using ANN's in Intrusion Detection Systems</span>
																		</a>
																		<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_673_257" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																			<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_156_488" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_156_488_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																				</li>
																			</ul>
																		</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Daniel Clarke posted Sep 19, 2016 2:59 AM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_160_985">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_159_964"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_680_4" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",33)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Using ANN's in Intrusion Detection Systems">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_681_235" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",34)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Using ANN's in Intrusion Detection Systems">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_161_448">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_682_206" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><ol>
<li>The goal of intrusion detection is detect when users that have
unauthorized access to a computer or are performing malicious activity
in an information system. &nbsp;Intruders can take the form of users
that have compromised a security system and do not have any
authorization to the system, or are users who have legitimate access to
the system but are exceeding their privileges [1]. &nbsp;The difficulty
with typical intrusion detection systems (IDS's) is that they operate on
 a rule based system that is fixed and set by a system administrator.
&nbsp;However, the intruders are intelligent agents that are adapting to
 systems and the rules that they employ. &nbsp;Therefore, if a system is
 to detect intruders effectively it must be able to learn and adapt to
changing attack methods. &nbsp;A system using a neural network can
theoretically operate and real time and could have the ability to learn
about new methods of attack against the system.</li>
<li>Previous papers have referenced the KDD CUP 99 dataset as well as
data from DARPA Intrusion Detection Evaluation datasets in 1998.
&nbsp;These datasets have been used repeatedly in testing IDS's and give
 a wealth of data points to test a system.</li>
<li>In Sen, Chattopadhyay, and Sen's paper on neural networks a
backpropogation learning network is implemented allowing for a flexible
IDS that can detect new anomalies [2]. &nbsp;Their system goes through
two stages: a training phase where it is trained using known attack
methods, and a testing phase where it is expected to detect anomalies
based on its training.</li>
</ol>
<p>In Brown, Anwar, and Dozier's paper an evolutionary general
regression neural network is implemented and described in great detail
[3]. &nbsp;By applying their algorithm to individual training instances
weights are attached to a neuron's connection and the system sees a user
 as normal or anomalous.</p>
<p>[1] Choudhary, A., Swarup, A.;&nbsp;<em>Neural Network Approach for Intrusion Detection;&nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="http://dl.acm.org.proxy.queensu.ca/citation.cfm?id=1656163&amp;CFID=839206619&amp;CFTOKEN=11606386">http://dl.acm.org.proxy.queensu.ca/citation.cfm?id=1656163&amp;CFID=839206619&amp;CFTOKEN=11606386</a></em></p>
<p>[2] Sen, R., Chattopadhyay, M., Sen, N.;&nbsp;<em>An Efficient Approach to Develop an Intrusion Detection System Based on Multi Layer Backpropagation Neural Network Algorithm</em>;&nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="http://dl.acm.org.proxy.queensu.ca/citation.cfm?id=2751979&amp;CFID=839206619&amp;CFTOKEN=11606386">http://dl.acm.org.proxy.queensu.ca/citation.cfm?id=2751979&amp;CFID=839206619&amp;CFTOKEN=11606386</a></p>
<p>[3] Brown, J., Anwar, M., Dozier, G.;&nbsp;<em>An Evolutionary General Regression Neural Network Classifier for Intrusion Detection</em>;&nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="http://ieeexplore.ieee.org.proxy.queensu.ca/stamp/stamp.jsp?tp=&amp;arnumber=7568493">http://ieeexplore.ieee.org.proxy.queensu.ca/stamp/stamp.jsp?tp=&amp;arnumber=7568493</a></p>
<p>[4] Subba, B., Biswas, S., Karmakar, S.;&nbsp;<em>A Neural Network Based System for Intrusion Detection and Attack Classification</em>;&nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="http://ieeexplore.ieee.org.proxy.queensu.ca/stamp/stamp.jsp?tp=&amp;arnumber=7561088">http://ieeexplore.ieee.org.proxy.queensu.ca/stamp/stamp.jsp?tp=&amp;arnumber=7561088</a></p>
<p>[5] Xiang, J., Sovilj, D., Westerlund, M., Pulkkis, G.;&nbsp;<em>Using Extreme Learning Machine for Intrusion Detection in a Big Data Environment</em>;&nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="http://dl.acm.org.proxy.queensu.ca/citation.cfm?id=2666664&amp;CFID=839206619&amp;CFTOKEN=11606386">http://dl.acm.org.proxy.queensu.ca/citation.cfm?id=2666664&amp;CFID=839206619&amp;CFTOKEN=11606386</a></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><span>&nbsp;</span></p></div>

																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446440/View" title="Assessing Renewable Energy System Performance with ANN ">Assessing Renewable Energy System Performance with ANN </a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_165_57" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_166_728" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Assessing Renewable Energy System Performance with ANN " onclick='D2L.O("__g1",35)();return false;'>

																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Jordan Nanos posted Sep 18, 2016 11:58 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_170_201">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_169_734"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_691_260" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",36)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Assessing Renewable Energy System Performance with ANN ">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_692_300" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",37)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Assessing Renewable Energy System Performance with ANN ">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_171_192">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_693_733" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><ol>
<li><strong> </strong><strong>What to do and why it is important. Describe existing work done on the topic and provide a list of references.</strong></li>
</ol>
<p>Renewable energy systems generate energy from a source that is
naturally replenished, such as solar, wind, nuclear or hydroelectric.
When compared to finite sources such as coal, oil or natural gas, it is
apparent why many consumers are moving to renewable energy systems.</p>
<p>A major concern that remains in this growing industry involves the
accurate estimation of available energy potential and effective control
of systems operation. By using the power of artificial neural networks,
complex systems can be studied without knowing the exact physical
relationships that exist.</p>
<p>A paper entitled “Application of Neural Networks Technique in
Renewable Energy Systems” (prepared by Lamine Thiaw, Gustave Sow, Salif
Fall for the 2014 First International Conference on Systems Informatics,
 Modelling and Simulation) contains additional details about the
existing work done on this topic.</p>
<p><strong>2. Data to be used. You can use data from your other studies
and course works. For ANN the more data you have the better the system
will work.</strong></p>
<p>To determine the maximum value of a PV generators efficiency, for
example, one would need to obtain data to describe the operating
conditions – specifically the irradiation, temperature and load values
of the system. This data would be used to determine the PV generators
“maximum power point” via a system control technique called Maximum
Power Point Tracking (MPPT).</p>
<p><strong>3. A very high level idea about the ANN or the optimization
algorithm (simulated annealing/genetic algorithm) to be used based on
your reading.</strong></p>
<p>The basic principle of MPPT is to control the output voltage and
input current at all times, thereby ensuring that the system is as close
 as possible to optimal performance. By using an ANN to implement the
control loop, there is no need to know the exact relation between inputs
 and outputs. As a result, mathematical modelling of the PV generator
can be simplified, effectively replacing the input data with equivalent
electrical values for the input/outputs.</p>
<p><strong>References:</strong></p>
<p>[1] Lamine Thiaw, Gustave Sow, Salif Fall. <em>Application of Neural Networks Technique in Renewable Energy Systems</em> (<a rel="noopener" href="http://ijssst.info/Vol-15/No-5/data/5198a006.pdf">http://ijssst.info/Vol-15/No-5/data/5198a006.pdf</a>)</p>
<p>[2] A. Mellita and S. A. Kalogiroub. Artificial intelligence
techniques for photovoltaic applications: A review. Progress in Energy
and Combustion Science, 34:574632, 2008.</p>
<p>[3] H.Silver. Neural networks in electrical engineering. In
Proceedings of the ASEE New England Section 2006 Annual Conference,
2006.</p>
<p>[4] Kalogirou, Soteris A. <em>Artificial neural networks in renewable energy systems applications: a review </em>(<a rel="noopener" href="http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1364032101000065">http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1364032101000065</a>)</p>
<p>[5] Ekici, Betul Bektas. <em>Predicition of building energy consumption by using artificial neural networks </em>(<a rel="noopener" href="http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0965997808001105">http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0965997808001105</a>)</p></div>
																			</div>

																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446389/View" title="The Use of ANN for Major League Sports Player Drafting">The Use of ANN for Major League Sports Player Drafting</a>
																			</h2>

																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Adam Noble-Marks posted Sep 18, 2016 11:40 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_180_316">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_179_904"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_702_560" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",39)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from The Use of ANN for Major League Sports Player Drafting">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_703_477" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",40)();return false;' title="Subscribe to The Use of ANN for Major League Sports Player Drafting">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_181_345">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_704_731" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p><strong>Concept:</strong></p>
<p>Using an ANN, determine which players in junior leagues are likely to
 have success in Major League Sports to improve the drafting success of
major league organizations.</p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>Importance:</strong></p>
<p>Professional sports organizations are notoriously poor at drafting to
 the point that draft pick success is determined nearly entirely by
luck. As these these draft picks are of critical importance to the
future success of these multi-million dollar teams, any improvement in
this area represents significant financial gains for these
organizations.</p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>Implementation:</strong></p>
<p>By observing a past dataset of junior players, the ANN can determine
which types of players go on to be future successes in the major
leagues. From there, the future success of current junior players can be
 predicted.</p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>Required Datasets:</strong></p>
<p>Junior league player data and corresponding major league player data.</p>
<p></p>
<p><strong>References:</strong></p>
<p>1. Zac Urback. "Introducing DEV" 2016. <a rel="noopener" href="http://prospect-stats.com/blog/Introducing_DEV.html">http://prospect-stats.com/blog/Introducing_DEV.html</a></p>
<p><span>2. Zac Urback. "Explaining&nbsp;DEV" 2016. http://prospect-stats.com/blog/Explaining_DEV.html</span></p>
<p><span>3.&nbsp;Kuan-Chieh Wang, Richard Zemel. "Classifying NBA
Offensive Plays Using Neural Networks".
http://www.sloansportsconference.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/1536-Classifying-NBA-Offensive-Plays-Using-Neural-Networks.pdf</span></p></div>
																			</div>
																		</div><div style="background: transparent linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0) 0%, rgb(255, 255, 255) 100%) repeat scroll 0% 0%; display: inherit;" class="vui-moreless-blur"></div><div style="display: inherit;" aria-hidden="true" class="vui-moreless-link" tabindex="0"><span class="vui-icon-moreless-chevron-down"></span>more</div>

														<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4518317" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4518317" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4518317" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446376">

																		<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>

																		<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446376/View" title="Autonomous Vehicle Navigation using ANNs">Autonomous Vehicle Navigation using ANNs</a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_185_844" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_186_130" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Autonomous Vehicle Navigation using ANNs" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",41)();return false;'>

																				<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_186_130_PrintThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																					<a target="_blank" role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_617_821 d2l-newwindow vui-dropdown-menu-item-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446376/Print"><span>Print Thread</span></a>
																				</li>
																			</ul>
																		</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Nick Hetherington posted Sep 18, 2016 11:31 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_190_205">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_189_376"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_713_648" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",42)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Autonomous Vehicle Navigation using ANNs">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_714_749" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",43)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Autonomous Vehicle Navigation using ANNs">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_191_330">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_715_806" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p><strong>Proposition and Importance</strong></p>
<p></p>
<p>I am interested in developing an ANN to control the navigation of a
mobile robot through an urban environment. Autonomous vehicles will
increasingly perform more important tasks in our society, such as
self-driving cars, military vehicles, and emergency response robots.</p>
<p><strong>Data</strong></p>
<p>A large amount of 3D point cloud data is available for urban
environments online. The library at [1] has a variety of datasets
available for use. The dataset at [2] is a very robust set of 3D scans
taken at the UPC Nord campus in Barcelona by the robotics research group
 there. I propose to train the network with this dataset, and test it
with another from [1].</p>
<p><strong>Algorithm</strong></p>
<p>The back-propagation through time (BPTT) method is widely used by
ANNs in autonomous vehicle navigation. Examples include the mobile robot
 at the Budapest University of Technology and Economics [3] and the
ALVINN vehicle [4]. The BPTT converts a recurrent network into a
feed-forward network in order to apply the back propagation algorithm
[5].</p>
<p><strong>References</strong></p>
<p>[1]&nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="http://www.pointclouds.org/news/2013/01/07/point-cloud-data-sets/">http://www.pointclouds.org/news/2013/01/07/point-cloud-data-sets/</a></p>
<p>[2]&nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="http://www.iri.upc.edu/research/webprojects/pau/datasets/BRL/downloads.php">http://www.iri.upc.edu/research/webprojects/pau/datasets/BRL/downloads.php</a></p>
<p>[3]&nbsp;<em>Engedy, Horvath&nbsp;</em>"Artificial Neural Network
based Mobile Robot Navigation",&nbsp;WISP 2009 • 6th IEEE International
Symposium on Intelligent Signal Processing • 26–28 August, 2009
Budapest, Hungary</p>
<p>[4]&nbsp;<em>Dean A. Pomerleau, "</em>Rapidly Adapting Artificial Neural Networks for Autonomous Navigation"</p>
<p>[5] "The Backpropagation Algorithm" (<a rel="noopener" href="https://page.mi.fu-berlin.de/rojas/neural/chapter/K7.pdf">https://page.mi.fu-berlin.de/rojas/neural/chapter/K7.pdf</a>)</p></div>
																			</div>

																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Will Mueller posted Sep 18, 2016 11:29 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_200_520">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_199_814"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_724_256" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",45)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Predict seizures in human EEG recordings">

																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_725_176" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",46)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Predict seizures in human EEG recordings">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>

																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_201_194">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_726_51" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p>Importance:</p>
<p>Epilepsy is a condition where uncontrolled firing within the brain
produces seizures. These seizures are a significant burden to
individuals afflicted with epilepsy and cause them significant anxiety.
The ability to&nbsp;predict seizures could help warn individuals and
prevent them from having seizures in dangerous situations.</p>
<p>Data:</p>
<p>Can be found here: <a rel="noopener" href="https://www.kaggle.com/c/melbourne-university-seizure-prediction">https://www.kaggle.com/c/melbourne-university-seizure-prediction</a>&nbsp;from The University of Melbourne.</p>
<p>Description:</p>
<p>ANN is fed a moving frame of EEG data and back propagation is used to
 determine if a seizure will occur in the&nbsp;following hour by making
the last layer one if a seizure occurs&nbsp;within an hour following
that input.</p></div>
																			</div>

																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446373/View" title="Artificial Neural Network to Predict Future Stock Prices">Artificial Neural Network to Predict Future Stock Prices</a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_205_407" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_206_56" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Artificial Neural Network to Predict Future Stock Prices" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",47)();return false;'>
																			<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">

																		<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_728_162" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																			<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_206_56" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_206_56_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Zachary Yale posted Sep 18, 2016 11:29 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_210_980">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_209_549"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_735_253" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",48)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Artificial Neural Network to Predict Future Stock Prices">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_736_674" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",49)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Artificial Neural Network to Predict Future Stock Prices">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_211_281">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_737_727" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><ol>
<li>Project Idea</li>
</ol>
<p>The stock market is an inherently chaotic system- one that is prone
to unpredictable fluctuations. The stock market is chaotic, and while
certain events (earnings reports, product launches, etc.) can justify
the change in a stock’s price, stocks often seem to often fluctuate
without any reliable means of predicting that behavior. By utilizing a
neural network to analyze stock market data, the neural net can analyze
both the predictable, and random aspects of the stock market at once,
allowing for an interesting prediction model for future stocks [1].</p>
<ol start="2">
<li>Data Sources</li>
</ol>
<p>Historically, there have been 6 input variables most common to neural
 nets that predict stock prices. These inputs are: current stock price,
variation of the price relative to the past day, direction of variation,
 direction of variation from two days prior, major variations relative
to the past day, and stock prices over the past 10 days [2]. While a
model utilizing this much information does get more reliable, the neural
 network consequently gets more complex. Since the time it takes to
train a neural network grows exponentially with the number of layers
within it, the system will only take into account historical stock data
(for use in backpropagation) [3]. Since stock market data is public
knowledge, finding a source for raw historical stock data will not be
difficult. For example, the United States has an online repository for
the Federal Reserve’s Economic Data [4], while sites like Yahoo and
Google offer API-services to fetch stock data.</p>
<ol start="2">
<li>High-level Implementation</li>
</ol>
<p>The most common approach to developing stock market prediction
software is to use a back propagation neural net, with a time series
that will account for historical stock data. The neural net will have
access to the past 10 days of price data for each stock under analysis,
and will train through analysis of the opening price, low price, high
price, and closing price of the stock [3].</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>References</p>
<p>[1]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; R. Lawrence, “Using Neural Networks to Forecast Stock Market Prices,” <em>Univ. Manit.</em>, Dec. 1997.</p>
<p>[2]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; M. Zekic,
“Neural Network Applications in Stock Market&nbsp; Predictions - A
Methodology Analysis.” University of Josip Juraj Strossmayer.</p>
<p>[3] https://people.eecs.berkeley.edu/~akar/IITK_website/EE671/report_stock.pdf</p>
<p>[4] https://fred.stlouisfed.org/&nbsp;</p></div>
																			</div>
																		</div><div style="background: transparent linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0) 0%, rgb(255, 255, 255) 100%) repeat scroll 0% 0%; display: inherit;" class="vui-moreless-blur"></div><div style="display: inherit;" aria-hidden="true" class="vui-moreless-link" tabindex="0"><span class="vui-icon-moreless-chevron-down"></span>more</div>

												<div class="d2l-datalist-item-content">
													<div aria-live="assertive" id="threadListItemContents_1446371" class="d2l-placeholder d2l-placeholder-inner d2l-placeholder-live">
														<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4518311" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4518311" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4518311" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446371">
															<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">
																<div>

																		<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>

																	<div class="d2l-inline">
																		<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446371/View" title="Pattern Recognition of Sign Language">Pattern Recognition of Sign Language</a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_215_640" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_216_607" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Pattern Recognition of Sign Language" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",50)();return false;'>
																			<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">
																			<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Pattern Recognition of Sign Language</span>
																		</a>
																		<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_739_402" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																			<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_216_607" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_216_607_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Aidan Gunda posted Sep 18, 2016 11:29 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_220_926">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_219_417"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_746_775" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",51)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Pattern Recognition of Sign Language">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_747_651" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",52)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Pattern Recognition of Sign Language">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_221_51">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_748_982" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p>Sign language is
widely used amongst those who cannot speak, but hardly amongst those who
 can hear. This greatly limits the number of people a person who is
incapable of using speech can communicate with. A neural network can be
used to give the dumb the ability to be understood by many once again
through image processing and translation.</p>
<p>Previous works aimed at giving the general population the ability to
understand sign language include a glove to be worn by the differently
able person. [1] The glove would recognize the hand signs of the user,
and then translate. Unfortunately, the glove can sometimes add
discomfort to its user, and has a delay between the input and output as
well.</p>
<p>Images taken of any person executing the hand sign can be taken as
the input. This would then be compared to and translated using online
databases. [1]</p>
<p>An image will be taken using a normal camera and resized. From there,
 the background of the image will be eliminated, with only the gesture
remaining. Backpropagation could be used, as the images from the camera
are compared to the database, teaching a machine how to recognize and
translate the hand-signs. [2]</p>
<p>[1]&nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="http://ieeexplore.ieee.org.proxy.queensu.ca/stamp/stamp.jsp?arnumber=6510261">http://ieeexplore.ieee.org.proxy.queensu.ca/stamp/stamp.jsp?arnumber=6510261</a></p>
<p>[2]&nbsp;http://ieeexplore.ieee.org.proxy.queensu.ca/stamp/stamp.jsp?arnumber=7058288</p></div>
																			</div>
																		</div><div style="background: transparent linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0) 0%, rgb(255, 255, 255) 100%) repeat scroll 0% 0%; display: inherit;" class="vui-moreless-blur"></div><div style="display: inherit;" aria-hidden="true" class="vui-moreless-link" tabindex="0"><span class="vui-icon-moreless-chevron-down"></span>more</div>

																		<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446367/View" title="ANN for Real-Time Logo/Image Recognition for AR Applications">ANN for Real-Time Logo/Image Recognition for AR Applications</a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_225_870" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_226_136" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for ANN for Real-Time Logo/Image Recognition for AR Applications" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",53)();return false;'>
																			<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">
																			<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for ANN for Real-Time Logo/Image Recognition for AR Applications</span>
																		</a>
																		<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_750_753" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																			<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_226_136" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_226_136_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																					<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_69_361 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Unread</span></a>

																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_226_136_FlagThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
