																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Alvin Xu posted Sep 18, 2016 11:28 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_230_518">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_229_619"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_757_176" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",54)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from ANN for Real-Time Logo/Image Recognition for AR Applications">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_758_221" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",55)();return false;' title="Subscribe to ANN for Real-Time Logo/Image Recognition for AR Applications">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_231_746">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_759_554" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p><strong><u>Project Idea and Importance</u></strong></p>
<p><u></u>Augmented Reality (AR) is an up and coming technological
platform with a profound amount of potential to change the way we
interact with the world. Augmented Reality consists of the ability to
process video/image data from the real-world, in real-time, &amp; then
digitally overlay contextual&nbsp;information to create a combined
virtual and real video/image. Currently, most forms of&nbsp;AR relies on
 robust image recognition, segmentation, and tracking in real time
(ideally greater than 30fps).&nbsp;</p>
<p>Logos were chosen as the focal point for this project idea, since
they would be of relevant interest to big corporations,&nbsp;who are
many of the early adopters in the field of AR. Images of logos are also
widespread and ubiquitous in day-to-day life, allowing for a wide set of
 training data.</p>
<p>However, the applications of real-time logo/image&nbsp;recognition
are much more far reaching, as a sufficiently good logo recognition
system should be able to recognize most user-defined images, with
applications ranging in everything from gaming
,to&nbsp;safety&nbsp;applications (like WHMIS), to social media, and
numerous other potential uses.</p>
<p></p>
<p><strong><u>Data</u></strong></p>
<p>There are many well-maintained logo databases on the internet from
reputable sources. Social media image websites such as Instagram can
also be used to find examples of logos seen in the the context of the
real-world. &nbsp;Many of these images will be scaled, transformed,
rotated, and skewed, with different levels of lighting and occlusion,
which provides variance, allowing us to train for more robust image
recognition in different real-world environments.<br><br><strong><u>High-Level Algorithm Overview</u></strong></p>
<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
 The neural network will use supervised learning to perform image
categorization, detecting specific features in a logo from its training
set. When provided a new image, the neural network will perform image
segmentation and try to find recognizable features or patterns, and try
to match them to a library of known logos that we trained.<br><br><strong><u>Citations</u></strong></p>
<p>[1] https://utah.pure.elsevier.com/en/publications/artificial-neural-network-classification-using-a-minimal-training</p>
<p>[2] http://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/3-540-64381-8_43</p>
<p>[3] https://aspire.eecs.berkeley.edu/wp/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/deeplogo_arxiv.pdf</p></div>
																			</div>
																		</div><div style="background: transparent linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0) 0%, rgb(255, 255, 255) 100%) repeat scroll 0% 0%; display: inherit;" class="vui-moreless-blur"></div><div style="display: inherit;" aria-hidden="true" class="vui-moreless-link" tabindex="0"><span class="vui-icon-moreless-chevron-down"></span>more</div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_624_348">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_625_979">

																			</div>

											<li class="d2l-datalist-item d2l-datalist-simpleitem" id="threadDataListItem_1446366">
												<div class="d2l-datalist-item-content">
													<div aria-live="assertive" id="threadListItemContents_1446366" class="d2l-placeholder d2l-placeholder-inner d2l-placeholder-live">
														<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4518304" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4518304" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4518304" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446366">
															<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">
																<div>
																	<div class="d2l-hidden">
																		<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-inline">
																		<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446366/View" title="Orchestrating Text Games with a Virtual Agent">Orchestrating Text Games with a Virtual Agent</a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_235_122" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_236_366" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Orchestrating Text Games with a Virtual Agent" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",56)();return false;'>
																			<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">
																			<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Orchestrating Text Games with a Virtual Agent</span>
																		</a>
																		<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_761_32" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																			<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_236_366" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_236_366_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																		</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Sam Hotchkiss posted Sep 18, 2016 11:27 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_240_787">
																			<img title="Last edited: Sunday, September 18, 2016 11:30 PM EDT" class="d2l-image d2l_1_768_421 d2l-left d2l_1_769_495" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt="Last edited: Sunday, September 18, 2016 11:30 PM EDT">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_239_112"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_770_132" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",57)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Orchestrating Text Games with a Virtual Agent">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_771_857" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",58)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Orchestrating Text Games with a Virtual Agent">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_241_767">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_772_726" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><ol>
<li>In this project, a virtual agent will learn how to orchestrate a
game by interacting with a human via a textual natural-language
interface. The agent will form a model of the game world and modify it
based on the instruction of a human. This will lead to an emergent
narrative in which the AI and human are collaborators.<br><br>Researchers have been exploring AI with narrative intelligence for some time. Examples include Mark Reidl's <em>Scheherezade</em>
 (a storytelling agent which can learn new stories and reproduce them
with novel language), Pablo Gervas's work on the MEXICA storytelling
system, and Jonathan Lessard's work on natural-language conversations in
 games.</li>
<li>Data will include a large corpus of textual fiction, consisting of
public domain works such as those in the Project Gutenberg database.</li>
<li>Genetic algorithms will be used to improve storytelling ability over
 several generations. The agent will be rewarded based on the quality of
 its storytelling.</li>
</ol>
<p>Sources:</p>
<div class="views-row views-row-2 views-row-even">
<div class="views-field-body">
<div class="field-content">
<p>Lara J. Martin and Mark O. Riedl. Improvisational Computational Storytelling in Open Worlds. <cite>Proceedings of the 2016 International Conference on Interactive Digital Entertainment</cite>, Los Angeles, California, 2016.</p>
<div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first">
<div class="views-field-body">
<div class="field-content">
<p>Lessard, Jonathan. « Design Rationale for Natural-Language Based Game
 Conversations ». In Demo Proceedings of the 10th International
Conference on the Foundations of Digital Games. Pacific Grove: CA, 2015.</p>
<div class="gs_citr">
<div class="gs_citr">Gervás, Pablo, et al. "On the fly collaborative story-telling: Revising contributions to match a shared partial story line." <i>Programme Committee and Reviewers</i> (2007): 13.</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>

																		<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446362/View" title="3D image Registration of knee replacement implant VIA CNN Regression">3D image Registration of knee replacement implant VIA CNN Regression</a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_245_922" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_246_405" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for 3D image Registration of knee replacement implant VIA CNN Regression" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",59)();return false;'>
																			<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">

																		</a>
																		<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_774_353" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																			<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_246_405" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_246_405_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																					<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_67_164 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Read</span></a>

																				</li>
																				<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_246_405_SeeHistory" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Anna Teng posted Sep 18, 2016 11:26 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_250_677">
																			<img title="Last edited: Sunday, September 18, 2016 11:54 PM EDT" class="d2l-image d2l_1_768_421 d2l-left d2l_1_769_495" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt="Last edited: Sunday, September 18, 2016 11:54 PM EDT">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_249_374"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_781_399" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",60)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from 3D image Registration of knee replacement implant VIA CNN Regression">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_782_615" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",61)();return false;' title="Subscribe to 3D image Registration of knee replacement implant VIA CNN Regression">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_251_427">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_783_875" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p><strong>1.What to do and why it is important.</strong></p>
<p>In knee replacements, metal and plastic parts are used to replace a
damaged knee. There are three types of surgery: partial only takes out
part of one knee, total (TKR) takes out one whole knee, and bilateral is
 when both knees are replaced at once.[4] This project&nbsp;will focus
on TKR.</p>
<p>Artificial neural networks can be used to predict the impairment for a total&nbsp;knee replacement.</p>
<p>A 2D-3D medical image registration can be implemented to compute the
3D positions of not only &nbsp;implants but also lower limb bones. Study
 [5] presents the following 3D postoperative analysis methods for total
knee arthroplasty (1) automatic calculation of relative angles of
implants and bones, (2) assessment of external rotation angles of
inserted implants, and (3) measurement and comparison of both
flexion-extension gap balances. These methods can be used as reference
in this project.</p>
<p><span>The main purpose of this project is to measure the functional impairment after TKR.</span></p>
<p><strong>2.Data Needed</strong></p>
<p><span>A possible database for this project is from National Joint registry data set:&nbsp;</span><span><a rel="noopener" href="http://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/data_dictionary/messages/clinical_content/content/national_joint_registry_data_set/national_joint_registry_data_set_-_knee_fr.asp?shownav=1">http://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/data_dictionary/messages/clinical_content/content/national_joint_registry_data_set/national_joint_registry_data_set_-_knee_fr.asp?shownav=1</a> &nbsp;</span>[2]<span>&nbsp;</span> The&nbsp;<span><a rel="noopener" href="http://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/data_dictionary/messages/clinical_content/overviews/national_joint_registry_data_set_overviews/national_joint_registry_data_set_introduction.asp?shownav=0">National Joint Registry Data Set</a>&nbsp;co</span>llects information on primary joint<strong>&nbsp;</strong>replacement surgery<strong>&nbsp;</strong>and revision&nbsp;<span>joint</span><strong>&nbsp;</strong><span>r</span><span>eplacement surgery</span>. A second data source would be from Canadian Institute for health information (Joint replacement) <a rel="noopener" href="https://www.cihi.ca/en/types-of-care/specialized-services/joint-replacements">https://www.cihi.ca/en/types-of-care/specialized-services/joint-replacements</a>.</p>
<p><strong>3.Algorithms</strong></p>
<p>A three-dimensional model will be constructed using Matlab.</p>
<p>Hybrid optimization algorithm (HPS) combining Powell's algorithm with
 the Nelder-Mead simplex (NM-simplex) algorithm can be applied to this
study [3].<span>&nbsp;</span>Convolutional Neural Network&nbsp;(CNN) based&nbsp;regression&nbsp;approach for estimating the<span>&nbsp;impairment is also proposed in this project.</span></p>
<p><span>References:</span></p>
<p>[1] Robust initialization for 2D/3D registration of knee implant models to single-plane fluoroscopy&nbsp;</p>
<p>Hermans - P. Claes - J. Bellemans - D. Vandermeulen - P. Suetens - Medical Imaging 2007: Image Processing - 2007</p>
<p>&nbsp;[2]&nbsp;http://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/data_dictionary/messages/clinical_content/content/national_joint_registry_data_set/national_joint_registry_data_set_-_knee_fr.asp?shownav=1</p>
<p>&nbsp;[3] Robust 2D/3D registration for fast-flexion motion of the knee joint using hybrid optimization</p>
<p>Takashi Ohnishi - Masahiko Suzuki - Tatsuya Kobayashi - Shinji
Naomoto - Tomoyuki Sukegawa - Atsushi Nawata - Hideaki Haneishi -
Radiological Physics and Technology Radiol Phys Technol – 2012</p>
<p>[4] Knee Replacement and Social Security Disability Benefits retrieved from <a rel="noopener" href="http://www.disabilitybenefitscenter.org/disabling-conditions/knee-replacement">http://www.disabilitybenefitscenter.org/disabling-conditions/knee-replacement</a></p>
<p>[5] Novel methods for 3D postoperative analysis of total knee arthroplasty using 2D–3D image registration</p>
<p>Youngjun Kim - Kang-Il Kim - Jin Choi - Kunwoo Lee - Clinical Biomechanics – 2011</p></div>
																			</div>
																		</div><div style="background: transparent linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0) 0%, rgb(255, 255, 255) 100%) repeat scroll 0% 0%; display: inherit;" class="vui-moreless-blur"></div><div style="display: inherit;" aria-hidden="true" class="vui-moreless-link" tabindex="0"><span class="vui-icon-moreless-chevron-down"></span>more</div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_624_348">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_625_979">
																				<div class="d2l-textblock d2l_1_626_60">0</div>
																				<div class="d2l-textblock d2l_1_627_991">Unread</div>
																			</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_625_979">
																				<div class="d2l-textblock d2l_1_626_60">0</div>
																				<div class="d2l-textblock d2l_1_627_991">Replies</div>
																			</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_625_979">
																				<div class="d2l-textblock d2l_1_626_60">4</div>
																				<div class="d2l-textblock d2l_1_627_991">Views</div>

											<li class="d2l-datalist-item d2l-datalist-simpleitem" id="threadDataListItem_1446358">
												<div class="d2l-datalist-item-content">
													<div aria-live="assertive" id="threadListItemContents_1446358" class="d2l-placeholder d2l-placeholder-inner d2l-placeholder-live">
														<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4518291" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4518291" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4518291" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446358">
															<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">
																<div>
																	<div class="d2l-hidden">
																		<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-inline">
																		<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446358/View" title="Surveillance Object Detection with ANNs">Surveillance Object Detection with ANNs</a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_255_469" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_256_116" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Surveillance Object Detection with ANNs" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",62)();return false;'>
																			<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">
																			<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Surveillance Object Detection with ANNs</span>
																		</a>
																		<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_785_774" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																			<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_256_116" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																				<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_256_116_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																		</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Athena Fung posted Sep 18, 2016 11:24 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_260_271">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_259_389"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_792_506" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",63)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Surveillance Object Detection with ANNs">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_793_805" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",64)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Surveillance Object Detection with ANNs">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_261_498">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_794_272" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><ol>
<li>Project Idea</li>
</ol>
<p>Millions of surveillance cameras are recording throughout the day
across the world. Of these millions, only a bare percentage of the
surveillance footage are monitored in real time. Most of the data
generated each day is dumped, only to be seen again if a crime or
accident occurs.</p>
<p>In order to make use of the real time data being generated, many
studies are being done towards developing methods to automatically
analyzing and understanding real time feed for multiple purposes
including: object detection [1] (eg. stolen vehicle detection [2]), or
event detection [3]. The idea of this project is to create an approach
for detecting objects in which a reactive measure would have to be
taken. &nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<ol start="2">
<li>Dataset&nbsp;</li>
</ol>
<p>For the scope of this project, the primary dataset will include many
video sequences which can be taken from any of the previously looked at
studies based on our specific needs.</p>
<ol start="3">
<li>ANN Optimization algorithm</li>
</ol>
<p>&nbsp;A multi-layer neural network, convolutional neural network,
similar to the one used in this action event recognition study [4],
should be implemented because of its automatic ability to learn
discriminative features.</p>
<p>&nbsp;References</p>
<p>[1] Chacon-Murguia, M., Gonzalez-Duarte, S. (2012). An Adaptive
Neural-Fuzzy Approach for Object Detection in Dynamic Backgrounds for
Surveillance Systems.</p>
<p>[2] Shyne, S. (1997). Distributed surveillance network utilizes neural networks for stolen vehicle detection. <em>Proc. SPIE</em><em>&nbsp;2938, Command, Control, Communications, and Intelligence Systems for Law Enforcement</em>. doi:10.1117/12.266739&nbsp;</p>
<p>[3] Knoblich, U., Trompf, M., Bar, S., Budiscak, B. (1998). Neural network-based event detection for surveillance applications.</p>
<p>[4] Wang, Q., Zhao, J., Gong, D. et al. Int J Parallel Prog (2016).
Parallelizing Convolutional Neural Networks for Action Event Recognition
 in Surveillance Videos. <em>Parallel Programming. </em>doi:10.1007/s10766-016-0451-4</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p></div>
																			</div>
																		</div><div style="background: transparent linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0) 0%, rgb(255, 255, 255) 100%) repeat scroll 0% 0%; display: inherit;" class="vui-moreless-blur"></div><div style="display: inherit;" aria-hidden="true" class="vui-moreless-link" tabindex="0"><span class="vui-icon-moreless-chevron-down"></span>more</div>

													<div aria-live="assertive" id="threadListItemContents_1446348" class="d2l-placeholder d2l-placeholder-inner d2l-placeholder-live">
														<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4518268" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4518268" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4518268" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446348">
															<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">
																<div>
																	<div class="d2l-hidden">
																		<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>

																		<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																			<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446348/View" title="Using ANN to Predict Winning Poker Hands">Using ANN to Predict Winning Poker Hands</a>
																			</h2>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																		<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_265_233" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_266_273" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Using ANN to Predict Winning Poker Hands" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",65)();return false;'>

																		</a>
																		<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_796_173" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																			<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_266_273" class="d2l-contextmenu">

																		<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Josh Horner posted Sep 18, 2016 11:17 PM</div>
																		<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_270_273">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																				<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_269_525"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_803_486" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",66)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Using ANN to Predict Winning Poker Hands">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																				</a>
																				<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_804_154" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",67)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Using ANN to Predict Winning Poker Hands">
																					<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																				</a>
																				</span></div>
																		</div>
																	</div>
																	<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																	<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_271_847">
																		<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_805_894" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																			<div>
																				<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p>1. Why is it Important</p>
<p>Games are often areas of interest when developing neural networks due
 to the range of situations they can present and use to reflect real
world scenarios. They are able to provide test beds for different
computational problems and designs. [1] Poker in particular draws a lot
of interest in this field due to it being a game on incomplete
information. [1] Poker is a widely played sport that requires a lot of
decision making and planning in order to win games. &nbsp;For this
reason I suggest creating a neural network that attempts to predict
winning hands for poker games and how they should be played out.</p>
<p></p>
<ol start="2">
<li>Data Sets</li>
</ol>
<p>There are freely available data sets that can be found online that
contain the different possible poker hands. [2] Other option for data
collection is to use hand history facilities or to obtain data from
screen captures of games. [3] There is also the possibility of
simulating poker games to gain data on winning and losing hands. [4]</p>
<p></p>
<ol start="3">
<li>ANN Idea</li>
</ol>
<p>To create this neural network supervise learning would be used. Using
 a feed forward neural network by providing it hands, decisions and
outcomes and using those decisions to determine whether a hand is a
winning hand and how it should be played. Backpropagation would be used
to weight hands and decisions to teach the neural network what decisions
 it should make.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>References</p>
<p>[1]Lucas, M., Kendall G. (2006, Febuary). Evolutionary Computation
and Games. Retrieved September 18, 2016 from
http://journals1.scholarsportal.info.proxy.queensu.ca/details/1556603x/v01i0001/10_ecag.xml</p>
<p>[2]Lichman, M. (2013). UCI Machine Learning Repository
[https://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/Poker+Hand]. Irvine, CA:
University of California, School of Information and Computer Science.</p>
<p>[3] Sakai, H. (). Internet Poker: Data and Collection Analysis.
Retrieved September 18, 2016, from
http://cs.brown.edu/research/pubs/theses/ugrad/2005/hsakai.pdf</p>
<p>[4] Davidson, A., Billings, D., Schaeffer, J. and Szafron, D., 2000.
Improved Opponent Modeling in Poker. Retrieved September 18, 2016, from
http://webdocs.cs.ualberta.ca/~duane/publications/pdf/2000icai.pdf</p></div>

																				<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446350/View" title="Predictive Crime Mapping of Kingston with ANNs">Predictive Crime Mapping of Kingston with ANNs</a>
																				</h2>

																				<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Predictive Crime Mapping of Kingston with ANNs</span>
																			</a>
																			<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_815_729" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																				<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_276_14" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_276_14_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_67_164 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Read</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_276_14_MarkAllUnread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_69_361 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Unread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_276_14_FlagThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_611_264 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Flag Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_276_14_PinThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_613_61 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Pin Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_276_14_SeeHistory" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_615_601 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>View Post History</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_276_14_PrintThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a target="_blank" role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_617_821 d2l-newwindow vui-dropdown-menu-item-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446350/Print"><span>Print Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																				</ul>
																			</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Christopher McIntyre posted Sep 18, 2016 11:19 PM</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_280_464">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																					<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_279_605"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_822_436" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",71)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Predictive Crime Mapping of Kingston with ANNs">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																					</a>
																					<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_823_164" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",72)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Predictive Crime Mapping of Kingston with ANNs">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																					</a>
																					</span></div>
																			</div>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_281_975">
																			<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_824_527" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																				<div>
																					<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p><strong>1. Project Concept</strong><br><br>The
 field of law enforcement is beginning to take advantage of the power of
 machine learning for crime prevention. This model of 'predictive
policing' involves the creation of heatmaps that anticipate probable
criminal activity at a given place and time, and the deployment of
additional law enforcement resources to act as an appropriate deterrent.
 The initial tests of these techniques in the field have mostly taken
place in the United States, and have generally met with success[1]. It
would be an interesting excercise to test the potential application of
predictive policing tools to a mid-sized Canadian city such as Kingston.<br><br>Though
 there have been some attempts to study artificial neural networks in
this domain[2][3][4], it remains an under-explored technique compared to
 other less complicated methods such as non-ANN linear regression
analysis. Investigating the strength and precision of a neural network
approach in a local context makes for a practical problem with potential
 read-world utility.<br><br><strong>2. Relevant Datasets</strong><br><br>Comprehensive
 crime statistics are readily available across many jurisdictions, due
to the relevance of that information to the public good. The Kingston
Police in particular publish calls-for-service reports through the
CrimeReports Geographical Informational System tool[5] developed by
Socrata. In addition to the CrimeReports GIS map interface, this dataset
 is also available in a tabular format[6] more suitable for analysis.<br><br><strong>3. Implementation</strong><br><br>There
 is some precedence for the use of feedforward multilayered perceptrons
in crime statistics analysis[3][4], taking advantage of backpropagation
learning. A similiar supervised approach to the Kingston data may be
effective in teaching a system to identify and predict potential
high-crime areas. However, part of the initial work for the project
would involve exploring the utility of other ANN paradigms, in the event
 that additional insight could be found through the use of unsupervised
systems.<br><br><strong>4. References</strong><br><br>[1] J. Bachner. "Predictive Policing" 2013. http://www.businessofgovernment.org/sites/default/files/Predictive%20Policing.pdf<br><br>[2]
 E. R. Groff, N. G. La Vigne. "Forecasting the Future of Predictive
Crime Mapping" 2002.
https://www.ncjrs.gov/App/Publications/abstract.aspx?ID=194018<br><br>[3]
 A. Olligschlaeger. "Artifical Neural Networks and Crime Mapping" 1998.
http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/summary?doi=10.1.1.131.8483<br><br>[4]
 S. Shojaee, A. Mustapha, F. Sidi, M.A. Jabar. "A Study on
Classification Learning Algorithms to Predict Crime Status" 2013.
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/266971832<br><br>[5] Kingston Police. <em>Crime Mapping</em>. https://www.kingstonpolice.ca/services/online/crime-mapping/<br><br>[6] Socrata. <em>Kingston Police incident dataset</em>. https://moto.data.socrata.com/dataset/Kingston-Police/fjwd-syvh</p></div>
																				</div>
																			</div><div style="background: transparent linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0) 0%, rgb(255, 255, 255) 100%) repeat scroll 0% 0%; display: inherit;" class="vui-moreless-blur"></div><div style="display: inherit;" aria-hidden="true" class="vui-moreless-link" tabindex="0"><span class="vui-icon-moreless-chevron-down"></span>more</div>

																					<div class="d2l-textblock d2l_1_627_991">Replies</div>
																				</div>
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_625_979">
																					<div class="d2l-textblock d2l_1_626_60">2</div>

													<div class="d2l-datalist-item-content">
														<div aria-live="assertive" id="threadListItemContents_1446343" class="d2l-placeholder d2l-placeholder-inner d2l-placeholder-live">
															<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4518261" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4518261" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4518261" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446343">
																<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">
																	<div>
																		<div class="d2l-hidden">
																			<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-inline">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																				<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446343/View" title="Sentiment analysis using emojis">Sentiment analysis using emojis</a>
																				</h2>
																			</div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																			<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_285_90" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_286_719" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Sentiment analysis using emojis" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",73)();return false;'>
																				<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">
																				<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Sentiment analysis using emojis</span>
																			</a>
																			<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_826_351" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																				<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_286_719" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_286_719_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_67_164 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Read</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_286_719_MarkAllUnread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_69_361 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Unread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_286_719_FlagThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_611_264 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Flag Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_286_719_PinThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_613_61 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Pin Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_286_719_SeeHistory" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_615_601 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>View Post History</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_286_719_PrintThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a target="_blank" role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_617_821 d2l-newwindow vui-dropdown-menu-item-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446343/Print"><span>Print Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																				</ul>
																			</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Aniqah Mair posted Sep 18, 2016 11:16 PM</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_290_5">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																					<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_289_914"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_833_626" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",74)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Sentiment analysis using emojis">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																					</a>
																					<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_834_917" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",75)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Sentiment analysis using emojis">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																					</a>
																					</span></div>
																			</div>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_291_975">
																			<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_835_343" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																				<div>
																					<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p><strong>What and Why</strong></p>
<p>The goal of this project is to create a neural network that is
capable of classifying text by sentiment, based on the sentiment
polarity of emoji characters contained within the text.</p>
<p>Emojis - pictures encoded as unicode characters - are increasingly
being used in textual communication, especially on social media websites
 such as Twitter. Much work on sentiment analysis of text (many using
Twitter data) has been done previously, but this work does not consider
the sentiments communicated through the use of emoji. [1,2,3] Note that
emojis, such as ☺, are distinct from emotions, such as :-).</p>
<p>Recent research has begun to analyse the sentiment associated with
individual emoji characters, but this does not account for the multiple
meanings that any one emoji can have. [4] For example, 💀 ("Skull";
U+1F480) can represent death in an angry way (negative), as well as
death from laughter (positive). Sentiment analysis must take into
account the multiple meanings that each emoji can have in order to
accurately classify text.</p>
<p>Emojis are not confined to one verbal language, and thus are
universal in their appeal and use. [5] (In fact, the word "emoji" is an
originally Japanese word meaning "picture character"). A neural network
that is able to properly classify text based on the sentiments contained
 within emojis will be unlimited by differences in language, dialect,
and slang.</p>
<p><strong>Data</strong></p>
<p>Because sentiment analysis of emojis is relatively new, I was unable
to find a publically available database of tweets with associated
sentiment polarity. However, data can be easily gathered from Twitter
itself by monitoring the firehose. [6] Manual collection will also
provide the opportunity to select from various Twitter communities which
 each have their own language patterns (such as Black Twitter) if so
desired.</p>
<p><strong>Algorithm Overview</strong></p>
<p>The neural network will be trained using with a diverse database of
tweets which each have an associated sentiment polarity. All tweets will
 contain emoji, ideally with a wide variety of emoji included in the
database. Backpropagation will be used to adjust the weight values after
 errors, allowing the neural network to learn from its mistakes and
better classify tweets in future. Backpropogation is especially
important because of the potential for misclassification due to the
multiple meanings of many emojis.</p>
<p><strong>References</strong><br><br>[1] Agarwal, A., Xie, B., Vovsha,
I., Rambow, O., Passonneau, R. 2011. Sentiment analysis of twitter data.
 Proc. ACL 2011 Workshop on Languages in Social Media, pp. 30–38.<br>[2]
 Svetlana Kiritchenko, Xiaodan Zhu, and Saif M. Mohammad. 2014.
Sentiment analysis of short informal texts. Journal of Artificial
Intelligence Research (JAIR), 50:723–762.<br>[3] Kouloumpis, E., Wilson,
 T., Moore, J. 2014. Twitter sentiment analysis: The good the bad and
the omg! Proceedings of the ICWSM.<br>[4] Kralj Novak P, Smailović J, Sluban B, Mozetič I. 2015. Sentiment of Emojis. PloS One 10 (12).<br>[5] http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2014/11/emojis-rapid-evolution.html<br>[6] https://dev.twitter.com/streaming/firehose</p></div>
																				</div>
																			</div><div style="background: transparent linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0) 0%, rgb(255, 255, 255) 100%) repeat scroll 0% 0%; display: inherit;" class="vui-moreless-blur"></div><div style="display: inherit;" aria-hidden="true" class="vui-moreless-link" tabindex="0"><span class="vui-icon-moreless-chevron-down"></span>more</div>
																			<div class="d2l_1_624_348">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_625_979">

																					<div class="d2l-textblock d2l_1_627_991">Unread</div>
																				</div>
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_625_979">
																					<div class="d2l-textblock d2l_1_626_60">0</div>
																					<div class="d2l-textblock d2l_1_627_991">Replies</div>
																				</div>
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_625_979">
																					<div class="d2l-textblock d2l_1_626_60">0</div>
																					<div class="d2l-textblock d2l_1_627_991">Views</div>

															<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4518257" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4518257" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4518257" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446340">

																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Kyle Macneil posted Sep 18, 2016 11:16 PM</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_300_649">
																				<img title="Last edited: Sunday, September 18, 2016 11:17 PM EDT" class="d2l-image d2l_1_768_421 d2l-left d2l_1_769_495" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt="Last edited: Sunday, September 18, 2016 11:17 PM EDT">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																					<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_299_161"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_844_616" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",77)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Outbreak Prediction Using Electronic Health Records">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																					</a>
																					<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_845_801" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",78)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Outbreak Prediction Using Electronic Health Records">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																					</a>
																					</span></div>
																			</div>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_301_173">
																			<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_846_923" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																				<div>
																					<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p style="padding-left: 30px;"><strong>1. <span style="text-decoration: underline;">What to do and Why It's Important</span></strong></p>
<p style="padding-left: 60px;"><strong></strong>Electronic Health
Records (EHR) are becoming commonplace in today's healthcare systems,
with 75.5% of US hospitals having at least a basic EHR system in place
[1]. This brings a large plethora of centralized medical data forward
that contains a wealth of valuable information regarding millions of
patients. Information such as age, gender, geographic location, social
factors, etc. are all present within these records.&nbsp;</p>
<p style="padding-left: 60px;">An area of interest becomes the outbreak
of illnesses and possible epidemic of a particular disease for a
particular geographic region. Often, outbreaks are not detected until
they've already reached outbreak level and this slows the possible
response to these outbreaks, at the expense of money, time, and possible
 death. By detecting possible outbreaks, the proper resources can be
mobilized, and the potential outbreak can be contained before it
spreads. &nbsp;</p>
<p style="padding-left: 60px;">There has been plenty of studies done
using the value of data in EHR's for prediction of things like surgical
outcomes [2], disease prediction [3], malaria outbreak [4], etc.; all
with the assistance of neural networks. There have also been outbreak
detection systems in other areas, such as in fire-detection, as
presented by Iorshase and Caleb [5]. This system also used a neural
network based approach for automatic detection of fire outbreaks in an
urban center. There are also numerous outbreak detection systems in
place that use different factors to try and detect outbreaks; such as
climate, algorithms using past data, and models based on millions of
different variables [6].</p>
<p style="padding-left: 30px;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>2. Data to be used</strong></span></p>
<p style="padding-left: 60px;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"></span>Electronic
 Health Records consists of a lot of personal information that makes
public access to such datasets a bit more difficult. Often, any access
to such datasets requires permission from governing bodies to conform
with HIPPA standards. However, there are some existing solutions that
provide remedies to this issue.&nbsp;</p>
<p style="padding-left: 60px;">The first is the Mock FHIR API by Catalyze (<a rel="noopener" href="https://catalyze.io/">https://catalyze.io/</a>)
 that provides the ability to generate mock patient EHR's that conform
to Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) standards and
therefore mirror what is found on a lot of EHRs generated by current
hospital systems.&nbsp;</p>
<p style="padding-left: 60px;">Additionally, Mount Sinai has a database
of patient info of over 2 million patients stored in the Mount Sinai
Data Warehouse (MSDW) recorded since 2003 that provides researchers a
wealth of structured information that can be organized in subsets to
study particular cohorts. There is also a query tool provided to
quantify eligible cohorts based on particular criteria.</p>
<p style="padding-left: 30px;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>3. ANN Usage</strong></span></p>
<p style="padding-left: 60px;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"></span>After
 reading over the many different uses of neural networks with EHRs, it
appears as though a possible solution would be to use a form of a multi
layer perceptron, such as a Three-Layer Perceptron Neural Network that
uses a feedforward approach. However, there could be issues depending on
 the dataset structure where the supervised learning approach may not be
 accurate for output prediction.&nbsp;</p>
<p style="padding-left: 60px;">Another possibility would be to use a
novel artificial neural network (ANN) designed by Cai and Jiang [7]. It
is an ANN based on Matrix Pseudo-Inversion and was generated for use in
solving the biomedical prediction problem over a variety of clinical
applications. It is a feed-forward neural network that has three layers
and has been demonstrated to be efficient for disease classification and
 prediction.&nbsp;</p>
<p style="padding-left: 60px;"></p>
<p><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>References</strong></span></p>
<ol>
<li><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong></strong></span><span style="text-decoration: underline;"></span>Charles,
 D., Gabriel, M., and T. Searcy.&nbsp;Adoption of Electronic Health
Record Systems among U.S. Non-Federal Acute Care Hospitals: 2008-2014.
2015, &nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="https://www.healthit.gov/sites/default/files/data-brief/2014HospitalAdoptionDataBrief.pdf">https://www.healthit.gov/sites/default/files/data-brief/2014HospitalAdoptionDataBrief.pdf</a></li>
<li>Sutherland, S. M., Chawla, L. S., Kane-Gill, S. L., Hsu, R. K., et
al. Utilizing electronic health records to predict acute kidney injury
risk and outcomes: workgroup statements from the 15th ADQI Consensus
Conference. <span>Can. J. Kidney Health Dis.&nbsp;</span>2016.</li>
<li>Wahyunggoro, O., Permanasari, A. E., and Chamsudin, A. Utilization of Neural Network for Disease Forecasting.&nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="http://www.statistics.gov.hk/wsc/IPS063-P4-S.pdf">http://www.statistics.gov.hk/wsc/IPS063-P4-S.pdf</a></li>
<li>Sharma, V., Kumar, A., Panat, L., Karajkhede, G., and Iele,
A.Malaria Outbreak Prediction Model Using Machine Learning. IJARCET.
2015.</li>
<li>Iorshase, A., and Caleb, S. F. A Neural Based Experimental
Fire-Outbreak Detection System for Urban Centres. J. Software
Engineering and Applications. 2016; 9, 71-79.</li>
<li>Ungerleider, N. Using Data, Scientists Can Predict Disease Outbreaks. 2013. Accessed online at:&nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="https://www.fastcompany.com/3018843/fast-feed/using-data-scientists-can-predict-disease-outbreaks">https://www.fastcompany.com/3018843/fast-feed/using-data-scientists-can-predict-disease-outbreaks</a></li>
<li>Cai, B., and Jiang, X. A novel artificial neural network method for
biomedical prediction based on matrix pseudo-inversion. J. Biomedical
Informatics. 2014; 48, 114-121.</li>
</ol></div>

																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Elena Pakka posted Sep 18, 2016 11:11 PM</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_310_454">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																					<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_309_728"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_855_491" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",80)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Predicting Air Pollution Levels">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																					</a>
																					<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_856_619" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",81)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Predicting Air Pollution Levels">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>

																					</span></div>
																			</div>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_311_620">
																			<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_857_64" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																				<div>
																					<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><ol>
<li><span>Air pollution is a worldwide problem that has negative affects
 on human health as well as the environment. With any large problem it
is important to know where to start. By modelling air pollution levels
we can predict where they will be highest and that can be an indicator
of where we need to focus our efforts most on reducing air pollution.
Monitoring air pollution levels or air quality has become an area of
interest for a while now. Specifically in urban areas, city populations
are continuously increasing and with more and more people in the same
space, there is a high demand for cleaner environments. Research has
been done on forecasting the concentration of principal air pollutants
[1] and air quality in different urban cities. Typically, this type of
research also includes analysis of factors such as traffic and weather
conditions. </span></li>
<li><span>Air quality databases [1] can be found online which contain
air quality data and statistics on air pollutants for specific
geographic regions. More information can be found on meteorological and
environmental government departments, for example one research paper [3]
 got data from the Malaysian Meteorological Department (MMD)</span></li>
<li><span>Some common methods for modelling this are self organizing
maps which is interesting because they employ competitive learning as
opposed to error-correction learning (seen in back-propagation) and
multi-layer perceptron models.<br></span></li>
</ol>
<p><span>References: </span></p>
<p><span>[1] <a rel="noopener" href="http://acm.eionet.europa.eu/databases/airbase">http://acm.eionet.europa.eu/databases/airbase</a></span></p>
<p><span>[2] <a rel="noopener" href="https://core.ac.uk/download/pdf/12007488.pdf">https://core.ac.uk/download/pdf/12007488.pdf</a></span></p>
<p><span>[3] </span>S. Ghazi, J. Dugdale and T. Khadir, "Modelling Air Pollution Crises Using Multi-agent Simulation,"&nbsp;<em>2016 49th Hawaii International Conference on System Sciences (HICSS)</em>, Koloa, HI, 2016.<span>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span>[4] </span>K. Bashir Shaban, A. Kadri and E. Rezk, "Urban Air Pollution Monitoring System With Forecasting Models," in&nbsp;<em>IEEE Sensors Journal</em>, vol. 16, no. 8,April15, 2016.</p>
<p><span>[5] </span>J. M. Barron-Adame, M. G. Cortina-Januchs, A.
Vega-Corona, D. Andina and J. I. S. Martinez-Echevarria, "Data fusion
and neural network combination method for air pollution level
monitoring,"&nbsp;<em>2009 7th IEEE International Conference on Industrial Informatics</em>, Cardiff, Wales, 2009,<span>&nbsp;</span></p>
<p><span>[6] </span>F. Mingjian, Z. Guocheng, Z. Xuxu and Y. Zhongyi,
"Study on Air Fine Particles Pollution Prediction of Main Traffic Route
Using Artificial Neural Network,"&nbsp;<em>Computer Distributed Control and Intelligent Environmental Monitoring (CDCIEM), 2011 International Conference on</em>, Changsha, 2011.</p></div>

															<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4518218" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4518218" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4518218" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446319">

																			<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>

																		<div class="d2l-inline">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																				<h2 class="d2l-linkheading d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446319/View" title="Pedestrian Detection with Neural networks">Pedestrian Detection with Neural networks</a>
																				</h2>
																			</div>
																			<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_315_294" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_316_600" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Pedestrian Detection with Neural networks" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",82)();return false;'>
																				<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">
																				<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Pedestrian Detection with Neural networks</span>
																			</a>
																			<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_859_520" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																				<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_316_600" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_316_600_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_67_164 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Read</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_316_600_MarkAllUnread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_69_361 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Unread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_316_600_FlagThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_611_264 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Flag Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_316_600_PinThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_613_61 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Pin Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_316_600_SeeHistory" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_615_601 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>View Post History</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_316_600_CopyThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_866_525 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Copy Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_316_600_PrintThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a target="_blank" role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_617_821 d2l-newwindow vui-dropdown-menu-item-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446319/Print"><span>Print Thread</span></a>
