																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Temi Ogunsanya posted Sep 18, 2016 9:54 PM</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_420_393">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																					<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_419_702"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_978_566" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",113)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Electrical Load Forecasting Using ANNs">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																					</a>
																					<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_979_351" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",114)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Electrical Load Forecasting Using ANNs">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																					</a>
																					</span></div>
																			</div>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_421_340">
																			<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_980_863" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																				<div>
																					<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p><strong><u>Idea</u></strong>/<strong><u>Importance</u></strong>:<br>Electrical
 load forecasting is the process of estimating the power and energy
requirements per region in order for utility companies to accurately
provide service to consumers. A number of methods can be used in order
to estimate the requirements, but the use of ANNs are one of the most
popular techniques[1].</p>
<p>Historical data sets can be used in order to develop the ANN that
will provide short-term Electrical load forecasting for a given region.</p>
<p><strong><u>Dataset</u></strong>:</p>
<p>A number of sources are available online that provide information on
weather conditions and electrical loads. Kaggle is one such example,
providing 4.5 years of historical data in CSV format [3]. The U.S Energy
 Information Administration (EIA) also has information on peak load and
monthly peak hour demand dating back to 2004. EIA also provides
predictions which can be used to validate the results of the ANN
constructed during the semester [4].</p>
<p><strong><u>Algorithm:</u></strong>&nbsp;</p>
<p>A number of different ANN’s can be implemented for electrical load
forecasting, but historically the most popular implementation would be
the back propagation method[1]. Back propagation will be used to
determine weights for the elemental inputs such as weather and day of
week based on historic electrical loads and the historic elemental
inputs from the given time region.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p><strong><u>References</u></strong>:</p>
<p>[1] LOAD FORECASTING &nbsp;<a rel="noopener" href="http://almozg.narod.ru/bible/lf.pdf">http://almozg.narod.ru/bible/lf.pdf</a></p>
<p>[2] Electric Load Forecasting Using An Artificial Neural Network <a rel="noopener" href="http://marksmannet.com/RobertMarks/REPRINTS/1991-05_ElectricLoadForecasting.pdf">http://marksmannet.com/RobertMarks/REPRINTS/1991-05_ElectricLoadForecasting.pdf</a></p>
<p>[3] Global Energy Forecasting Competition 2012 - Load Forecasting<a rel="noopener" href="https://www.kaggle.com/c/global-energy-forecasting-competition-2012-load-forecasting/data?temperature_history.csv">https://www.kaggle.com/c/global-energy-forecasting-competition-2012-load-forecasting</a></p>
<p>[4] Form EIA-411 Data &nbsp;https://www.eia.gov/electricity/data/eia411/</p></div>

													<div class="d2l-datalist-item-content">
														<div aria-live="assertive" id="threadListItemContents_1446135" class="d2l-placeholder d2l-placeholder-inner d2l-placeholder-live">
															<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4517899" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4517899" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4517899" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446135">
																<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">
																	<div>
																		<div class="d2l-hidden">
																			<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-inline">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																				<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446135/View" title="Understanding Autism through ANNs">Understanding Autism through ANNs</a>
																				</h2>
																			</div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																			<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_425_691" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_426_685" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Understanding Autism through ANNs" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",115)();return false;'>
																				<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">
																				<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Understanding Autism through ANNs</span>
																			</a>
																			<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_982_803" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																				<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_426_685" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_426_685_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_67_164 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Read</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_426_685_MarkAllUnread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_69_361 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Unread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_426_685_FlagThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_611_264 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Flag Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_426_685_PinThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_613_61 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Pin Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_426_685_SeeHistory" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																					</li>
																					<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_426_685_PrintThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a target="_blank" role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_617_821 d2l-newwindow vui-dropdown-menu-item-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446135/Print"><span>Print Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																				</ul>
																			</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Alexandra Poole posted Sep 18, 2016 9:45 PM</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_430_531">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																					<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_429_144"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_989_442" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",116)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Understanding Autism through ANNs">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																					</a>
																					<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_990_792" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",117)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Understanding Autism through ANNs">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																					</a>
																					</span></div>
																			</div>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_431_702">
																			<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_991_965" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																				<div>
																					<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><div>1. What to do and why.&nbsp;</div>
<div></div>
<div>Autism is an incredibly complex disorder. Research has been
primarily focused on looking at the genes and molecules of autistic
patients. However there are still so many questions to be answered
&nbsp;regarding the disorder. Research is now being shifted to study the
 neural networks of people with autism, which leads to a better
understanding of the disorder, while also aiding in its diagnoses.</div>
<div></div>
<div>Some research has been done modelling the visual cortex, as well as
 modelling selective attention and generalization deficits. Based on
knowledge that patients with autism behave differently in several
psychophysiological visual tasks, research has focused on modelling
simple changes in neuronal activity such as increased signal due to the
hyperactivity in some regions of the autistic brain. So far they have
been successful in recreating performance of a person with autism,
giving a better understanding of experimental data. With ANNs
researchers are learning whether attention and generalization deficits
are due to having too few or too many neural connections in specific
regions of the brain.&nbsp;</div>
<div></div>
<div>2. Data to be used</div>
<div></div>
<div>Data would be taken from psychological studies
of&nbsp;children&nbsp;with autism and how they perform in visual task,
attention and generalization tasks compared to a control group.&nbsp;</div>
<div></div>
<div></div>
<div><span>3. Type of ANN</span></div>
<div><span></span></div>
<div><span>Artificial&nbsp;neural networks would simulate&nbsp;complex
object recognition tasks, as well as focused attention tasks. Single
parameters would be changed, as to locate specific problems autism
causes in the tasks.&nbsp;</span></div>
<div><span></span></div>
<div><span>References</span></div>
<div><span></span></div>
<div><span>Are Artificial Neural Networks the key to Unravelling the Mysteries of Autism</span></div>
<div><span><a rel="noopener" href="http://singularityhub.com/2015/08/09/are-artificial-neural-networks-the-key-to-unravelling-the-mysteries-of-autism/">http://singularityhub.com/2015/08/09/are-artificial-neural-networks-the-key-to-unravelling-the-mysteries-of-autism/</a></span></div>
<div><span></span></div>
<div><span>An Artificial Neural Network Analogue of Learning in Autism</span></div>
<div><span>http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0006322394900574</span></div>
<div>
<h1 class="post-title"></h1>
</div></div>

																<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">

																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																				<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446125/View" title="Using machine learning to predict the performance of major league baseball playersUsing machine learning to predict the performance of major league baseball players">Using
 machine learning to predict the performance of major league baseball
playersUsing machine learning to predict the performance of major league
 baseball players</a>
																				</h2>
																			</div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																			<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_435_905" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_436_100" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Using machine learning to predict the performance of major league baseball playersUsing machine learning to predict the performance of major league baseball players" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",118)();return false;'>

																			<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_993_74" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																				<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_436_100" class="d2l-contextmenu">

																			</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Matt Sims posted Sep 18, 2016 9:40 PM</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_440_1">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																					<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_439_802"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_1000_219" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",119)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Using machine learning to predict the performance of major league baseball playersUsing machine learning to predict the performance of major league baseball players">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																					</a>
																					<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_1001_117" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",120)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Using machine learning to predict the performance of major league baseball playersUsing machine learning to predict the performance of major league baseball players">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																					</a>
																					</span></div>
																			</div>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_441_94">
																			<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_1002_152" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																				<div>
																					<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p>What it is and why it is important:</p>
<p>Data science including the use of machine learning for the use of
baseball predictive analytics falls under a termed coined sabermetrics. I
 aim to use the research initially done by Bill James with sabermetrics
and apply his research in combination with machine learning techniques
to predict how players may perform on a given period of time. [1] In a
sport where the average player has a salary of $4.38 million (USD) it is
 important to be able to reasonably predict how well that player will
perform relative to the price it takes to maintain/acquire a player.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Current research has been done to identify the most relevant features
 that can be used to predict the quality of play by a baseball player,
these are the metrics in sabermetrics. There has also been a lot of
research done with relevance to machine learning however much of this
work is proprietary and thus hasn’t been published.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>Data to be used:</p>
<p>Data will be scraped from [2] sabr.org. They have data from every mlb game since 1900 including pre-calculated sabermetrics.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>How the ANN will be used:</p>
<p>The goal will be able to create a model that will take in a number of
 sabermetric variables out after generating parameter values of the
model and use said inputs to generate an expected value for output
variables such as runs, hits, walks, etc. The training data will consist
 of the outcomes of each player’s performance for each game.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>References:</p>
<p>[1]: <a rel="noopener" href="http://www.ibtimes.com/how-much-do-mlb-players-make-opening-day-average-salary-grows-438m-2347906">http://www.ibtimes.com/how-much-do-mlb-players-make-opening-day-average-salary-grows-438m-2347906</a></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>[2]: <a rel="noopener" href="http://sabr.org/sabermetrics/data">http://sabr.org/sabermetrics/data</a></p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>[3]: <a rel="noopener" href="http://s3.amazonaws.com/academia.edu.documents/39441963/Predicting_Run_Production_and_Run_Preven20151026-19732-10wff1t.pdf?AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAJ56TQJRTWSMTNPEA&amp;Expires=1474084216&amp;Signature=XlQGzMwnk2xKKAMPPWIgk%2B4%2Bfvk%3D&amp;response-content-disposition=inline%3B%20filename%3DPredicting_run_production_and_run_preven.pdf">http://s3.amazonaws.com/academia.edu.documents/39441963/Predicting_Run_Production_and_Run_Preven20151026-19732-10wff1t.pdf?AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAJ56TQJRTWSMTNPEA&amp;Expires=1474084216&amp;Signature=XlQGzMwnk2xKKAMPPWIgk%2B4%2Bfvk%3D&amp;response-content-disposition=inline%3B%20filename%3DPredicting_run_production_and_run_preven.pdf</a></p></div>

																				<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446111/View" title="Predicting the default rate of personal loans using ANN">Predicting the default rate of personal loans using ANN</a>
																				</h2>
																			</div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																			<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_445_153" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_446_358" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Predicting the default rate of personal loans using ANN" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",121)();return false;'>
																				<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">
																				<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Predicting the default rate of personal loans using ANN</span>
																			</a>
																			<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_1004_51" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																				<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_446_358" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_446_358_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																					</li>
																					<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_446_358_PrintThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a target="_blank" role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_617_821 d2l-newwindow vui-dropdown-menu-item-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446111/Print"><span>Print Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																				</ul>
																			</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Victor Mimo posted Sep 18, 2016 9:32 PM</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_450_852">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																					<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_449_102"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_1011_123" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",122)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Predicting the default rate of personal loans using ANN">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																					</a>
																					<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_1012_544" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",123)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Predicting the default rate of personal loans using ANN">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																					</a>
																					</span></div>
																			</div>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_451_762">
																			<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_1013_400" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																				<div>
																					<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p></p>
<ol>
<li>What to do and why its important</li>
</ol>
<p>Traditionally, the due diligence done on a personal loan is for the
ultimate purpose of separating “good” customers (customers who pay their
 loans on time or early) from “bad” customers (customers that are likely
 to default) [1]. However, over the last decade, a new incentive for
doing the correct due diligence on a loan is not simply to ensure only
customers with a good credit are approved, but also to determine a
customer’s likely default rate.</p>
<p>By incorporating models that estimate a customer’s likely default
rate, and focus on predicting it, the entity doing the research will
have the ability to estimate the profitability over a customer’s
lifetime, estimate default levels overtime for the purpose of debt
provisioning, and estimate terms of a loan for each individual customer.</p>
<p>Banks and insurance firms have traditionally used statistical models
for predicting the likely hood of an average person in a certain
demographic will default. However, these models tend to be rather
general and may not fit each customer specifically. By using ANN models,
 default rate prediction has been shown to be much more accurate.</p>
<ol start="2">
<li>Data to be used</li>
</ol>
<p>Public data for personal loans are quite vast. Because personal loans
 cover a wide range of loan categories, a lot of data can be gathered
about each category to determine the risk of each type. Some examples of
 finding data for categories include government data on Freddie Mac and
Fannie Mae for Mortgage loans [4], and on the Federal Reserve for
Consumer Credit data [5]. Also, there are an increasing number of
financial technology start ups in this space, who are often releasing
datasets for research purposes, such as LendingClub [6].</p>
<ol start="3">
<li>ANN Algorithm</li>
</ol>
<p>A high level neural network is the Ravdin and Clark algorithm. It
uses a multi-layer feed-forward neural network with a single output unit
 representing the survival status of the loan (ie. Whether defaulted or
not) [1].</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>[1] <a rel="noopener" href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.203.5969&amp;rep=rep1&amp;type=pdf">http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.203.5969&amp;rep=rep1&amp;type=pdf</a></p>
<p>[2] <a rel="noopener" href="http://www.bankrate.com/finance/loans/personal-loan-demand-to-increase-in-2016.aspx">http://www.bankrate.com/finance/loans/personal-loan-demand-to-increase-in-2016.aspx</a></p>
<p>[3] <a rel="noopener" href="http://www.cnbc.com/2016/02/05/in-a-pinch-more-consumers-turning-to-personal-loans.html">http://www.cnbc.com/2016/02/05/in-a-pinch-more-consumers-turning-to-personal-loans.html</a></p>
<p>[4] <a rel="noopener" href="http://www.cnbc.com/2016/02/05/in-a-pinch-more-consumers-turning-to-personal-loans.html">http://www.cnbc.com/2016/02/05/in-a-pinch-more-consumers-turning-to-personal-loans.html</a></p>
<p>[5] <a rel="noopener" href="http://www.federalreserve.gov/releases/g19/current/">http://www.federalreserve.gov/releases/g19/current/</a></p>
<p>[6] <a rel="noopener" href="https://www.lendingclub.com/info/download-data.action">https://www.lendingclub.com/info/download-data.action</a></p></div>
																				</div>
																			</div><div style="background: transparent linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0) 0%, rgb(255, 255, 255) 100%) repeat scroll 0% 0%; display: inherit;" class="vui-moreless-blur"></div><div style="display: inherit;" aria-hidden="true" class="vui-moreless-link" tabindex="0"><span class="vui-icon-moreless-chevron-down"></span>more</div>
																			<div class="d2l_1_624_348">

												<li class="d2l-datalist-item d2l-datalist-simpleitem" id="threadDataListItem_1446094">
													<div class="d2l-datalist-item-content">
														<div aria-live="assertive" id="threadListItemContents_1446094" class="d2l-placeholder d2l-placeholder-inner d2l-placeholder-live">
															<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4517809" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4517809" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4517809" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446094">
																<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">
																	<div>
																		<div class="d2l-hidden">

																		<div class="d2l-inline">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																				<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446094/View" title="SMS Spam Filtering Using ANN">SMS Spam Filtering Using ANN</a>
																				</h2>
																			</div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																			<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_455_368" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_456_829" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for SMS Spam Filtering Using ANN" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",124)();return false;'>

																				<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for SMS Spam Filtering Using ANN</span>
																			</a>
																			<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_1015_84" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																				<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_456_829" class="d2l-contextmenu">

																			</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Marley Ferreira-Malyon posted Sep 18, 2016 9:21 PM</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_460_163">
																				<img title="Last edited: Sunday, September 18, 2016 9:23 PM EDT" class="d2l-image d2l_1_768_421 d2l-left d2l_1_769_495" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt="Last edited: Sunday, September 18, 2016 9:23 PM EDT">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																					<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_459_885"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_1022_344" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",125)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from SMS Spam Filtering Using ANN">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																					</a>
																					<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_1023_339" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",126)();return false;' title="Subscribe to SMS Spam Filtering Using ANN">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																					</a>
																					</span></div>
																			</div>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_461_593">
																			<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_1024_287" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																				<div>
																					<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p><strong>Project Idea and Importance</strong></p>
<p>Spam is a categorical name given to electronic messages that are
unwanted, intrusive and usually quite irrelevant to the recipient. Such
messages are often disguised to appear friendly or appealing in various
ways, or at the very least of high importance. In actuality, however,
these messages are sent with varying degrees of malicious intent,
ranging from simple advertisement to phishing or identity theft scams.</p>
<p>Usage of the term “spam” generally refers to email spam, the oldest
and most common form. Because of this, individuals have gotten quite
well equipped to handle email spam. Various filtering systems have been
developed and updated to remove as many of these bulk-messages as
possible, with an increasingly high success rate.</p>
<p>However, other forms of spam are now increasing in popularity. In
particular, spam sent via The Short Messaging Service (SMS) is becoming a
 significant issue in many countries. The increasing affordability and
availability of cheap, unlimited texting mobile plans, along with SMS’s
reputation as being a more trusted and secure form of communication
(leading to a higher spam success rate), are contributing to the rise of
 spammers choosing SMS as their means of communication. [1]</p>
<p>The relatively recent influx of SMS spam has meant that filtering
systems have not had the same amount of time or data to reach acceptable
 standards, when compared to email. The differences in SMS format,
including lack of subject line, differences in sender identification,
message length and language communication conventions unique to text
messages, make simply applying an email filter relatively ineffective.
&nbsp;[1]</p>
<p>For this project, application of artificial neural networks and
genetic algorithms could be used to apply various elements of email
filtering techniques, text parsing and pattern recognition to attempt
SMS spam filtering in a unique way. Currently, very few mobile devices
have any sort of spam filter in use with their texting applications, and
 thus further iterations of this project deliverable could be used to
develop mobile applications or OS procedures.</p>
<p><strong>Data</strong></p>
<p>Finding sources of SMS data can be difficult. This data is usually
help by private companies, who are not incentivized to release it,
especially when SMS spam is a much less widespread and discussed topic
as that of email. [1] Luckily, there are some resources for such data
available. One such example, a SMS collection data set from UC Irvine
Machine Learning Repository [2], would be a good resource for this
project, as it contains a varied mix of spam and “ham” (legitimate SMS
messages) from various public sources, and are labeled as such.</p>
<p>In addition, various lists of relevant advertising/spam keywords and
phrases, along with common SMS conventions, abbreviations and acronyms
would be aggregated together for use in the filtering process. Some of
these can be the same as those used in email, but others types of data
unique to SMS are harder to retrieve. [1] Some sources are available,
but are of varying length, quality and dependability, while also being
subject to regional and cultural variation. Continuation of this project
 would explore potential resources and solutions to this issue.</p>
<p><strong>Algorithm and Procedure Overview</strong></p>
<p>Initially, by either procedural string parsing or separate neural
network implementations, whichever is more practical, various iterations
 over the data would be performed to “clean up the data” would be
performed, as is done in email filtering systems. [3] Such processes
could include removing certain useless words, compare distance and
occurrence of keywords/symbols, occurrence of capital letters, length of
 the message, and other criteria. This portion of the project would be
dependent on the team’s capacity to implement certain features and
overall progress during the semester, with criteria being added or
removed with change in project scope.</p>
<p>Finally, once various attribute scores are determined for relevant
criteria, this data will be fed to the input nodes of a back-propagation
 neural network. [4] Dependant on the variation and number of attributes
 being evaluated, this data will fire through a number of hidden
artificial neuron layers, initially with random threshold values. The
values transmitted by these hidden layers will then reach the output
node, which will then, based on it’s own threshold, will deduce the
nature of the message. [5] During training, the network will be subject
to supervised learning, where the result (“spam” or “ham”) determined by
 the network will be compared to the known result. This will then be
back-propagated through the network, changing weights and threshold
values within the network, allowing it to learn. A small remaining
portion of the data, once learning and debugging has occurred, will be
used solely for testing, to examine the networks success rate.</p>
<p>Practical application of this network would involve user feedback
with the network, confirming its decision with the user, and
adjusting/continuing to learn as new messages arrived.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>[1]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; S. J.
Delany, M. Buckley, and D. Greene, “SMS spam filtering: Methods and
data,” <em>Expert Syst. Appl.</em>, vol. 39, no. 10, pp. 9899–9908, 2012.</p>
<p>[2]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; “UCI Machine Learning Repository: SMS Spam Collection Data Set.” .</p>
<p>[3]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A. Nosseir,
 K. Nagati, and I. Taj-Eddin, “Intelligent Word-Based Spam Filter
Detection Using Multi-Neural Networks,” <em>Int. J. Comput. Sci. Issues IJCSI</em>, vol. 10, no. 2 Part 1, pp. 17–21, Mar. 2013.</p>
<p>[4]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; G. Ruan and
 Y. Tan, “A three-layer back-propagation neural network for spam
detection using artificial immune concentration,” <em>Soft Comput.</em>, vol. 14, no. 2, pp. 139–150, 2010.</p>
<p>[5]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; K. Mehrotra, C. K. Mohan, and S. Ranka, <em>Elements of Artificial Neural Networks</em>. MIT Press, 1997.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p></div>

															<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4517804" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4517804" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4517804" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446092">

																				<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446092/View" title="Analyzing User Behavior with ANN in Video Games">Analyzing User Behavior with ANN in Video Games</a>
																				</h2>
																			</div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																			<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_465_930" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_466_377" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Analyzing User Behavior with ANN in Video Games" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",127)();return false;'>
																				<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">
																				<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Analyzing User Behavior with ANN in Video Games</span>
																			</a>
																			<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_1026_746" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																				<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_466_377" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_466_377_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_67_164 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Read</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_466_377_MarkAllUnread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_69_361 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Unread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_466_377_FlagThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																					</li>
																				</ul>
																			</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Kevin Huang posted Sep 18, 2016 9:20 PM</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_470_715">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																					<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_469_376"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_1033_468" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",128)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Analyzing User Behavior with ANN in Video Games">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																					</a>
																					<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_1034_132" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",129)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Analyzing User Behavior with ANN in Video Games">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																					</a>
																					</span></div>
																			</div>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_471_569">
																			<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_1035_746" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																				<div>
																					<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><ol>
<li>
<p>Project Idea: I am interested in analyzing user behavior with ANN in
video games, this includes game behavior and the users’ inputs and
actions within a game.</p>
<p>Importance: With more than 1.2 billion people playing video games
over the world[1], it is important to understand how video games can
affect users’ behavior within and outside of video games. With the use
of an ANN, it is possible to detect an array of user behavior including
but not limited to, fatigue, stress, emotions, strategy, and screening
of deficit or adequateness to a task[2]. In turn, this data could help
further research on how video games affect an individual and can help
game developers understand their players and their habits within their
games.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Data to be used: Noor Shaker provides a database known as the
“Platformer Experience Dataset (PED)”[3]. This database includes player
experience data captured through context based (e.g. game content) and
behavioral and visual recordings. The database also includes
demographical data about the users and self-reports on the users’
experience in two forms: ratings and ranks.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Algorithm: For the analysis of user behavior, a classical Multi-Layer
 Perceptron (MLP)[4] with a back propagation learning algorithm will be
used. This algorithm mainly focuses on pattern recognition[5]. The
recognition will be used to analyze user behavior in real-time and
provide the researcher with information on how the user is interacting
and feeling during a video game.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p><strong>References:</strong></p>
<p>[1]&nbsp;<span>"More than 1.2 Billion People Are Playing&nbsp;games." </span><i>VentureBeat</i><span>. N.p., n.d. Web. 18 Sept. 2016.</span></p>
<p><span>[2]&nbsp;Puzenat, Didier, and Isabelle Verlut. "Behavior Analysis through Games Using Artificial Neural Networks." <i>IEEE Xplore Document - Behavior Analysis through Games Using Artificial Neural Networks</i><span>. N.p., n.d. Web. 18 Sept. 2016.</span></span></p>
<p><span><span>[3]&nbsp;"Noor Shaker." <i>Platformer Experience Dataset</i><span>. N.p., n.d. Web. 18 Sept. 2016.</span></span></span></p>
<p><span><span>[4]&nbsp;"Multilayer Perceptron." <i>Wikipedia</i><span>. Wikimedia Foundation, n.d. Web. 18 Sept. 2016.</span></span></span></p>
<p><span><span><span>[5]&nbsp;Bishop, Christopher M. <i>Neural Networks for Pattern Recognition</i><span>. Oxford: Clarendon, 1995. Print.</span></span></span></span></p></div>
																				</div>

													<div class="d2l-datalist-item-content">
														<div aria-live="assertive" id="threadListItemContents_1446090" class="d2l-placeholder d2l-placeholder-inner d2l-placeholder-live">
															<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4517802" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4517802" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4517802" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446090">
																<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">
																	<div>

																			<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-inline">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																				<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446090/View" title="Identifying Online Advertisements">Identifying Online Advertisements</a>
																				</h2>
																			</div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																			<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_475_298" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_476_484" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Identifying Online Advertisements" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",130)();return false;'>
																				<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">
																				<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Identifying Online Advertisements</span>
																			</a>
																			<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_1037_494" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																				<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_476_484" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_476_484_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_67_164 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Read</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_476_484_MarkAllUnread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_69_361 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Unread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_476_484_FlagThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_611_264 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Flag Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_476_484_PinThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_613_61 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Pin Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_476_484_SeeHistory" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																					</li>
																					<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_476_484_PrintThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a target="_blank" role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_617_821 d2l-newwindow vui-dropdown-menu-item-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446090/Print"><span>Print Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																				</ul>
																			</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Jake Fantin posted Sep 18, 2016 9:19 PM</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_480_333">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																					<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_479_934"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_1044_474" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",131)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Identifying Online Advertisements">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																					</a>
																					<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_1045_669" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",132)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Identifying Online Advertisements">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																					</a>
																					</span></div>
																			</div>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_481_14">
																			<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_1046_421" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																				<div>
																					<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><ol>
<li><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Idea/Importance</span></li>
</ol>
<p></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Many sites on the internet are
supported by hosting advertisements. Many of the creators of these
advertisements use images as they are eye catching when contrasted to
the text the fills the rest of a given webpage. Many of these images can
 be intrusive due to their sharp colors and size, especially when viewed
 on a mobile device. Therefore it can be useful to detect these images
and remove them, for the better experience of the user.[1]</span></p>
<p></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Since websites have their own images
to relay information to the user, the issue comes down to categorizing
and identifying which images belong to the website.[2]</span></p>
<p></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">A group from Wuhan University had the
 idea is to use a NN to classify images as either an advertisement or
not, based on a number of parameters that separate them.[1] Hopefully
with more parameters or more a greater classification rate can be
achieved. Another group took a different route to make a program that
reduces images to their key features in order to classify them easier.
[3]</span></p>
<p></p>
<ol start="2">
<li><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Data to be used.</span></li>
</ol>
<p></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The online advertisement database </span><a rel="noopener" href="https://www.coloribus.com/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">https://www.coloribus.com/</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">
 can be used as a source for images that would have a lot of the data
needed for classification. However, if the positioning on a page is
taken in as a parameter, that information must be recorded manually
after loading a given webpage.</span></p>
<p></p>
<ol start="3">
<li><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Algorithm</span></li>
</ol>
<p></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">If the classification was performed
using a set of parameters then the program would have a number of inputs
 and only two desired outputs. The neural network could be structured
using a multilayered perceptron neural network and it would be trained
using back-propagation.</span></p>
<p></p>
<p>References:</p>
<p></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">[1] </span><i><span style="font-weight: 400;">G. Changsheng, Z. Fuxi, Y. Haitao, </span></i><span style="font-weight: 400;">“</span><i><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sensitivity Analysis of Neural Network Parameters for Advertising Images Detection” (2010)</span></i></p>
<p><a rel="noopener" href="http://ieeexplore.ieee.org.proxy.queensu.ca/document/5459956/references"><span style="font-weight: 400;">http://ieeexplore.ieee.org.proxy.queensu.ca/document/5459956/references</span></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">[2]</span><i><span style="font-weight: 400;">T. Maekawa, T. Hara and S. Nishio, "Image classification for mobile web browsing", Proc' WWW2006</span></i><span style="font-weight: 400;">.</span></p>
<p><a rel="noopener" href="https://www.researchgate.net/publication/221022417_Image_classification_for_mobile_web_browsing"><span style="font-weight: 400;">https://www.researchgate.net/publication/221022417_Image_classification_for_mobile_web_browsing</span></a></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">[3]</span><i><span style="font-weight: 400;">Song, X., Zhang, J., Han, Y. et al. Multimedia Systems (2016) 22: 41. doi:10.1007/s00530-014-0390-0</span></i></p>
<p><a rel="noopener" href="http://link.springer.com.proxy.queensu.ca/article/10.1007%2Fs00530-014-0390-0"><span style="font-weight: 400;">http://link.springer.com.proxy.queensu.ca/article/10.1007%2Fs00530-014-0390-0</span></a></p></div>

															<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4517714" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4517714" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4517714" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1446046">

																				<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446046/View" title="Inderstanding the affects of Meditation on the brain using ANN">Inderstanding the affects of Meditation on the brain using ANN</a>
																				</h2>
																			</div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																			<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_485_767" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_486_591" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Inderstanding the affects of Meditation on the brain using ANN" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",133)();return false;'>
																				<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">
																				<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Inderstanding the affects of Meditation on the brain using ANN</span>
																			</a>
																			<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_1048_411" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																				<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_486_591" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_486_591_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_67_164 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Read</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_486_591_MarkAllUnread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_69_361 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Unread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_486_591_FlagThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_611_264 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Flag Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_486_591_PinThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_613_61 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Pin Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																					<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_486_591_SeeHistory" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">

																					</li>
																					<li role="separator" class="d2l-contextmenu-separator"></li>
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_486_591_PrintThread" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a target="_blank" role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_617_821 d2l-newwindow vui-dropdown-menu-item-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1446046/Print"><span>Print Thread</span></a>
																					</li>
																				</ul>
																			</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Seema Hejazi posted Sep 18, 2016 8:56 PM</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_490_75">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																					<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_489_56"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_1055_889" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",134)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Inderstanding the affects of Meditation on the brain using ANN">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																					</a>
																					<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_1056_772" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",135)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Inderstanding the affects of Meditation on the brain using ANN">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																					</a>
																					</span></div>
																			</div>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_491_464">
																			<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_1057_811" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																				<div>
																					<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p class="p1"><span class="s1"><span class="Apple-tab-span"> </span>Studies
 have found that the practice of meditation is linked to positive
changes in brain structure suggesting that it helps prevent mental
illness, affects memory and boosts connectivity and efficiency of neural
 networks. Meditation can be described as the use of cognitive abilities
 and selective attention of a system to learn about itself. This can be
viewed as a neuro-biological optimization technique. Using the ANN model
 to simulate the effects of meditation on the brain, the findings could
be used to better understand how to treat mental illnesses as well as
consciously affecting the neural connections. <br> <span class="Apple-tab-span"> </span>This
 study is important because few people take advantage of a meditation
practice to chose the way they react to life. This study could help
people understand the connections they’ve made through learning in
development to relearn certain things to reach better outcome. <br><br>Many
 studies have shown the positive effect of meditation, and I’ll be using
 the data from those divers studies to create the ANN to simulate the
results. <br> <span class="Apple-tab-span"> <br></span>The ANN will
first be fed data to which simulates the development of the brain. Then,
 the input will given which uses reinforcement learning to change or
strengthen networks. The intention is to find ‘bad habit’ connection and
 recreate it the way meditation can recreate connections to enhance
positive responses. If successful we should see a complete reformation
of the artificial neural networks which show that the previous
connection is now unlearned.<br><br></span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><a rel="noopener" href="https://www-hindawi-com.proxy.queensu.ca/journals/ecam/2015/254358/">https://www-hindawi-com.proxy.queensu.ca/journals/ecam/2015/254358/<br></a></span><span class="s2">Effects of a Mindfulness Meditation Course on Learning and Cognitive Performance among University Students in Taiwan<br></span><span class="s2">Ho-Hoi Ching, Malcolm Koo, Tsung-Huang Tsai, and Chiu-Yuan Chen</span></p>
<p class="p2"><span class="s2"></span></p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><a rel="noopener" href="https://www-hindawi-com.proxy.queensu.ca/journals/np/2016/9504642/">https://www-hindawi-com.proxy.queensu.ca/journals/np/2016/9504642/<br></a></span><span class="s2">State and Training Effects of Mindfulness Meditation on Brain Networks Reflect Neuronal Mechanisms of Its Antidepressant Effect<br></span><span class="s2">Chuan-Chih
 Yang,1 Alfonso Barrós-Loscertales, Daniel Pinazo, Noelia
Ventura-Campos, Viola Borchardt, Juan-Carlos Bustamante, Aina
Rodríguez-Pujadas, Paola Fuentes-Claramonte, Raúl Balaguer, César Ávila,
 and Martin Walter</span></p>
<p class="p1"><a rel="noopener" href="http://ieeexplore.ieee.org.proxy.queensu.ca/document/6201675/">http://ieeexplore.ieee.org.proxy.queensu.ca/document/6201675/<br></a>Modeling and function assessing with meditation training on brain functional memory network <br>Lanhua Zhang,&nbsp;Jin Wang,&nbsp;&nbsp;Xiujuan Wang,&nbsp;&nbsp;Shaowei Xue</p>
<p class="p1"><span class="s1"><br><br> </span></p></div>
																				</div>
																			</div><div style="background: transparent linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0) 0%, rgb(255, 255, 255) 100%) repeat scroll 0% 0%; display: inherit;" class="vui-moreless-blur"></div><div style="display: inherit;" aria-hidden="true" class="vui-moreless-link" tabindex="0"><span class="vui-icon-moreless-chevron-down"></span>more</div>

												</li>
												<li class="d2l-datalist-item d2l-datalist-simpleitem" id="threadDataListItem_1445999">
													<div class="d2l-datalist-item-content">
														<div aria-live="assertive" id="threadListItemContents_1445999" class="d2l-placeholder d2l-placeholder-inner d2l-placeholder-live">
															<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4517629" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4517629" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4517629" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1445999">
																<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">
																	<div>
																		<div class="d2l-hidden">
																			<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-inline">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																				<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1445999/View" title="Predicting Weather Conditions using ANN">Predicting Weather Conditions using ANN</a>
																				</h2>
																			</div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																			<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_495_407" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_496_175" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Predicting Weather Conditions using ANN" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",136)();return false;'>
																				<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">
																				<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Predicting Weather Conditions using ANN</span>
																			</a>
																			<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_1059_284" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																				<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_496_175" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_496_175_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_67_164 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Read</span></a>

																			</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Keaton Ward posted Sep 18, 2016 8:38 PM</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_500_775">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																					<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_499_785"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_1066_885" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",137)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Predicting Weather Conditions using ANN">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																					</a>
																					<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_1067_76" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",138)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Predicting Weather Conditions using ANN">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																					</a>
																					</span></div>
																			</div>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_501_574">
																			<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_1068_268" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																				<div>
																					<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><ul>
<li><strong>Project Proposal and Importance:</strong></li>
</ul>
<p>With climate change making weather less and less predictable in the
modern world, finding a way to accurately predict weather very important
 not only to the general public, but also to many industries that depend
 on weather conditions to properly operate. This includes the airline
industry being able to predict and avoid harsh flying conditions, the
energy industry being able to predict the production of their solar,
wind and hydro plants, and even the stock market being able to
accurately buy or sell weather derivatives on their exchanges&nbsp;<span>[1]</span> .</p>
<p>In each of the cases above, as well as in many other industries,
being able to accurately predict the weather is of the utmost
importance. Traditionally, weather researches have attempted to make a
linear connection between the input weather data and the corresponding
target data. However, it has been found that there is non-linearity
between these two sets of data, and non-linear modelling often requires
the model to be specified before the estimation is done, which is
difficult to do because the weather follows very irregular trends&nbsp;<span>[2]</span>.
 This is where Advanced Neural Networks (ANN) can be used to accurately
model weather conditions, as the system will learn more and more about
weather trends and how they are changing as more data is fed into the
system, even with climate change playing a role, and provide that
information to the industries mentioned above in order to help them make
 day to day decisions on the operation of their business, and to allow
the public to be better informed of potential weather hazards&nbsp;<span>[3]</span>.</p>
<ul>
<li><strong>Data to be used:</strong></li>
</ul>
<p>Weather data is quite easy to get a hold of, as it has been recorded
by the Government of Canada dating back to 1840 in some areas&nbsp;<span>[4]</span>.
 This data includes temperature, humidity, wind speed, and precipitation
 data in high detail (available in hourly, daily, and monthly
intervals)&nbsp;<span>[5]</span>. The data of one of these climate
factors can be used to fine tune the algorithm, and then that algorithm
can be applied to the other factors.</p>
<ul>
<li><strong>Algorithm</strong></li>
</ul>
<p>Research has been done in terms of which type of Artificial Neural
Network is best suited to predicting weather conditions, and it has been
 determined that a Radial Basis Function Network (RBFN) is best suited
to predicting weather patterns [2]. Therefore, this type of network is a
 good fit for this project.</p>

																<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">

																		<div class="d2l-hidden">
																			<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-inline">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																				<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1445994/View" title="Usage of ANN in time series analysis of gene expression data">Usage of ANN in time series analysis of gene expression data</a>
																				</h2>
																			</div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																			<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_505_283" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_506_4" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Usage of ANN in time series analysis of gene expression data" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",139)();return false;'>

																				<span class="d2l-offscreen">Actions for Usage of ANN in time series analysis of gene expression data</span>
																			</a>
																			<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_1070_56" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																				<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_506_4" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_506_4_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_67_164 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Read</span></a>

																					</li>

																			</div><div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-textblock-secondary d2l-left d2l_1_618_395">Tal Shapira posted Sep 18, 2016 8:34 PM</div>
																			<div class="d2l-left" id="d2l_1_510_883">
																				<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_619_265 d2l-inline">
																					<span tabindex="-1" class="d2l-toggle" id="d2l_1_509_310"><a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink d2l-hidden" id="d2l_1_1077_733" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",140)();return false;' title="Unsubscribe from Usage of ANN in time series analysis of gene expression data">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_78_974" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribed</span>
																					</a>
																					<a href="javascript:void(0);" class="d2l-text-imagelink" id="d2l_1_1078_864" onclick='D2L.O("__g1",141)();return false;' title="Subscribe to Usage of ANN in time series analysis of gene expression data">
																						<img class="d2l-text-imagelink-img d2l_1_79_606" src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" alt=""><span class="d2l-text-imagelink-text">Subscribe</span>
																					</a>
																					</span></div>
																			</div>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-clear"></div>
																		<div class="d2l_1_622_891" id="d2l_1_511_237">
																			<div style="line-height: normal; height: 63px;" class="vui-moreless" id="d2l_1_1079_616" data-moreless-lesstitle="less" data-moreless-moretitle="more" data-moreless-accessible="False" data-moreless-blurcolor="#FFFFFF" data-moreless-height="63px">
																				<div>
																					<div class="d2l-htmlblock"><p><strong><u>Project Idea</u></strong></p>
<p>Combination of ANN and genetic algorithms will be used to get
insights from genetic data and treatment information of critical care
patients. The aim is improving the treatment that is given to patients
and increasing the survival rate in internal care units. The information
 that will be used is genetic expression profile, symptoms and treatment
 description. Changes in gene expression between time points and drug
groups will be inspected in relation to the following topics:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Identifying patients in risk of developing an infection.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Predicting drug response.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>Unsupervised and supervised learning models will be applied in order to perform analysis of the data:<br>The
 first step will include unsupervised clustering - Self Organizing Maps
will be applied separately for samples from different time points.
Samples in the same or adjacent clusters will be compared to drug groups
 information.<br>The second step will include supervised learning using
neural networks: Feature selection will be performed to identify the
most prominent genes according to disease symptoms<sup>1</sup>. Finally,
 feature selection according to previous studies will be performed,
which suggest that specific genes could predict infection risk among
patients<sup>2</sup>.</p>
<p><strong><u>Data</u></strong></p>
<p>Microarray technology is a popular technology for gene expression profiling <sup>3</sup>,
 the activity measurement of thousands of genes at once. The project
will use Microarrays samples that has been taken from intensive care
unit patients in Kingston General Hospital. The samples are divided to
multiple time points and drug groups. There are necessary preliminary
steps to prepare gene expression data for usage. These steps will
include normalization <sup>4</sup>, outliers detection<sup>5</sup> and filtering of low variability genes <sup>6</sup>.</p>
<p><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>Citations</strong></span></p>
<ol>
<li>Holden AJ, Robbins DJ, Stewart WJ, et al. Reducing the dimensionality of data with neural networks. <em>Science (80- )</em>. 2006;313(July):504-508. doi:10.1126/science.1127647.</li>
<li>Dybowski R, Gant V, Weller P, Chang R. Prediction of outcome in
critically ill patients using artificial neural network synthesised by
genetic algorithm. <em>Lancet</em>. 1996;347(9009):1146-1150. doi:10.1016/S0140-6736(96)90609-1.</li>
<li>Karakach TK, Flight RM, Douglas SE, Wentzell PD. An introduction to DNA microarrays for gene expression analysis. <em>Chemom Intell Lab Syst</em>. 2010;104(1):28-52. doi:10.1016/j.chemolab.2010.04.003.</li>
<li>Smyth GK, Speed T. Normalization of cDNA microarray data. <em>Methods</em>. 2003;31(4):265-273. doi:10.1016/S1046-2023(03)00155-5.</li>
<li>Shieh AD, Hung YS. Detecting Outlier Samples in Microarray Data. <em>Stat Appl Genet Mol Biol</em>. 2009;8(1):1-24. doi:10.2202/1544-6115.1426.</li>
<li>Newton MA, Kendziorski CM, Richmond CS, Blattner FR, Tsui KW. On
Differential Variability of Expression Ratios: Improving Statistical
Inference about Gene Expression Changes from Microarray Data. <em>J Comput Biol</em>. 2001;8(1):37-52. doi:10.1089/106652701300099074.</li>
</ol>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p></div>

												<li class="d2l-datalist-item d2l-datalist-simpleitem" id="threadDataListItem_1445990">
													<div class="d2l-datalist-item-content">
														<div aria-live="assertive" id="threadListItemContents_1445990" class="d2l-placeholder d2l-placeholder-inner d2l-placeholder-live">
															<div class="d2l-le-disc-post d2l-le-disc-post-border d2l-le-disc-post-unread d2l_1_603_166" data-postid="4517612" data-contextmenuid="postContextMenu_4517612" data-postunreadtextid="postUnread_4517612" data-contentsplaceholderid="threadListItemContents_1445990">
																<div class="d2l-le-disc-posrev">
																	<div>
																		<div class="d2l-hidden">
																			<span class="d2l-fragment"><a style="top: -44px;" name="" tabindex="-1"></a></span>
																		</div>
																		<div class="d2l-inline">
																			<div class="d2l-left d2l_1_604_734 d2l_1_605_104">
																				<h2 class="d2l-linkheading-level3 d2l-ellipsis"><a tabindex="0" class="d2l-linkheading-link d2l-clickable vui-link" href="https://onq.queensu.ca/d2l/le/56359/discussions/threads/1445990/View" title="Use ANN to Control Prosthetic Limbs and Wheel Chairs ">Use ANN to Control Prosthetic Limbs and Wheel Chairs </a>
																				</h2>
																			</div>
																			<div class="d2l-textblock d2l-offscreen">Contains unread posts</div>
																			<a href="javascript:void(0);" id="d2l_1_515_149" class="d2l-contextmenu-ph d2l-left" data-contextmenuid="d2l_1_516_356" role="button" aria-haspopup="true" title="Actions for Use ANN to Control Prosthetic Limbs and Wheel Chairs " onclick='D2L.O("__g1",142)();return false;'>
																				<img src="Project%20Idea%20Post%20Forum%20-%20CISC_CMPE%20452_COGS%20400_CISC%20874%20-%20Neural%20and%20Genetic%20Cognitive%20Models%20F16_files/pixel.gif" class="d2l_1_73_234" alt="">

																			<div tabindex="-1" role="menu" id="d2l_1_1081_472" class="d2l-floating-container vui-dropdown-menu d2l-hidden d2l-floating-container-autoclose">
																				<ul role="presentation" id="d2l_1_516_356" class="d2l-contextmenu">
																					<li role="presentation" id="d2l_1_516_356_MarkAllRead" class="d2l-contextmenu-item">
																						<a role="menuitem" tabindex="-1" class="d2l_1_67_164 vui-dropdown-menu-item-link"><span>Mark All Posts as Read</span></a>
